682510.title: Guiltless Warm Flourless Chocolate Cake
instruction_list: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
Place 8 (4-ounce) ramekins or custard cups on a large baking sheet.
Spray with cooking spray and set aside.
Combine chocolate, orange zest and vanilla extract in a medium bowl over hot boiling water.
Whisk until chocolate is completely melted.
Puree bananas, sweet potato and honey until smooth.
Remove the melted chocolate from heat and fold over banana puree and 1 whole egg.
Mix well.
Whip the egg whites until soft peak.
Slowly fold egg whites into chocolate mixture.
Spoon mix into ramekins, filling them almost to the top.
Bake for approximately 6 to 7 minutes, remove and serve.
Warm center of the chocolate should be soft.

999895.title: Soft and Chewy Chocolate Chip Cookies
ingredient_list: 1 12 cups margarine or 1 12 cups butter, softened
instruction_list: Heat oven to 375F In large bowl, beat sugar, brown sugar, and margarine until light and fluffy.
Add vanilla and eggs; blend well.
Add flour, baking soda, and salt; mix well.
Stir in chocolate chips.
Drop dough by rounded tablespoons 2 inches apart onto ungreased cookie sheets.
Bake at 375F for 8 to 10 minutes or until light golden brown.

259069.title: The Best Chocolate Chip Cookies
ingredient_list: 1 cup walnuts (optional) or 1 cup pecans, chopped (optional)
instruction_list: Heat oven to 375 degrees F.
Stir flour with baking soda and salt; set aside.
In large mixing bowl, beat butter with sugar and brown sugar at medium speed until creamy and lightened in color.
Add eggs and vanilla, one at a time.
Mix on low speed until incorporated.
Gradually blend dry mixture into creamed mixture.
Stir in nuts and chocolate chips.
Drop by tablespoon onto un-greased cookie sheets.
Bake for 9 to 11 minutes or until golden brown.

354105.title: Super Chocolate Chip Cookies
ingredient_list: 12 cup butter or 12 cup margarine, softened
1 cup firmly packed light brown sugar
instruction_list: Preheat oven to 350.
In a small bowl stir together the flour, baking soda and salt; set aside.
In large bowl beat the butter or margerine, shortening and sugars until creamy.
Beat in eggs and vanilla.
Add flour mixture and mix well.
Stir in the chocolate chips and nuts.
Drop by rounded teaspoonfuls 2-inches apart onto ungreased baking sheets.
Bake 10 to 12 minutes or until lightly browned.
For Oatmeal Chocolate Chip Cookies: Decrease the flour to 1 3/4 cup and add 1 1/2 cups oatmeal to dry ingredients.
Proceed with recipe as written above.

600109.title: The Best Big Chocolate Chip Cookies
instruction_list: Preheat oven to 325F.
Cream softened butter and both the brown and white sugar until well blended, then beat in the vanilla and eggs.
Sift flour, baking soda, and salt in one bowl and then mix this to the wet ingredients.
Stir in the chocolate chips by hand.
Drop about 1/4 of a cup of dough onto greased cookie sheets about 3 inches apart.
Bake for about 15 to 18 minutes or until they start to look brown at the bottom, then let them sit for a few minutes before switching them to a wire rack to cool.

9679.title: Double/Triple/Quadruple Chocolate Chip Cookies Recipe angegrl96
instruction_list: Make regular chocolate chip cookies.
When adding chocolate chips add as many bags as you want.

130423.title: Chocolate Chip Cookies Kahlua Milkshakes
ingredient_list: 2 whole Large Chocolate Chip Cookies, Plus 1 More For Crumbles
instruction_list: Add all ingredients to a blender and process until almost smooth, leaving some small pieces of cookie if possible.
Pour in glasses and crumble more cookies on top.
Serve!

87172.title: Oatmeal Raisin Chocolate Chip Mallow Cookies
ingredient_list: 1 cup coarsely broken graham cracker (4 whole crackers)
1 cup NESTLE TOLL HOUSE Milk Chocolate Morsels
instruction_list: PREHEAT oven to 325F.
CRUMBLE dough into large bowl.
With spoon or lightly floured hands, stir in graham crackers and morsels.
Drop by rounded teaspoonfuls onto ungreased baking sheets.
BAKE for 14 to 15 minutes or until golden brown around edges.
Cool on baking sheet; remove to wire racks to cool.
While cookies are still warm, with back of measuring teaspoon, make an indentation in each cookie.
Fill indentation with 1/2 measuring teaspoon of marshmallow creme.
Store in layers between sheets of wax paper in covered container.

210166.title: Chocolate Chip Peanut Butter Cup Cookies Recipe
ingredient_list: Toll house chocolate chip dough made with mini chips
instruction_list: Special Instructions: Use a non-stick mini muffin pan.
Preheat the oven to 350 degrees.
Fill the muffin tin c. with one tsp.
of dough.
Cook about 12 min or possibly till brown.
Unwrap the Reese's.
Press one peanut butter c. into each cooked "cookie" muffin.
Turn the muffin pan over and they will all fall out!

390249.title: Healthy Dairy Free Chocolate Chip Cookies
ingredient_list: 1 cup Dairy, Nut & Soy Free Chocolate Chips
instruction_list: Mix all ingredients together and drop spoonfuls of dough onto a cookie sheet.
Bake at 350 degrees F for approximately 30 minutes.
Note: If your bananas are not super ripe, you can expedite the process by roasting them in the oven at 350 degrees F (still in the skins) for about 10 minutes.

258287.title: Easy Pumpkin Chocolate Chip Cookies
ingredient_list: 1 (15 ounce) can solid pack pumpkin (NOT pumpkin pie filling)
1 (12 ounce) package semi-sweet chocolate chips or 1 (12 ounce) package milk chocolate chips
instruction_list: Pre-heat oven to 350 degrees.
Mix together pumpkin and spice cake until well blended.
Add chocolate chips to mix.
Drop cookies on greased baking sheet.
Bake for 15-18 minutes.

280159.title: Reese's Oreo Chocolate Chip Cookies
ingredient_list: 1 chocolate chip cookie dough(I used Pillsbury chocolate chip cookie dough)
instruction_list: preheat oven to 350
separate oreos keeping both cream sides
put a Oreo half on each side of Reese's cup
with a very thin layer of your cookie dough completely cover the Oreo Reese's combo
foil cookie sheet and spray with cooking spray
multiply recipe for as many cookies as you want
bake in oven for 12-15 min
let cool until chocolate solidifies( put in refrigerator to cool faster)

8148.title: Double Chocolate Chip Cookies Recipe
ingredient_list: 1 box German chocolate cake mix or possibly chocolate fudge cake mix
instruction_list: Mix ingredients thoroughly.
Drop by tsp.
on cookie sheet.
Bake at 350 degrees 9 to 10 min.

729206.title: Healthy Chocolate Chip Cookies
ingredient_list: 175 g sugar-free applesauce (I made my own, just chop the apples and put them in a pot until soft. Blend)
instruction_list: Put oatmeal in the blander.
Blend until fine.
It doesn't have to all be like flour.
Mix flax-meal with water and stir thoroughly.
Leave to rest.
Put oatmeal into a bowl with sieved sugar and apple-sauce.
Beat until fully combined.
Check the flax-meal mixture.
It should have a goopy texture, almost egg-like.
If not, leave it for longer.
If so, beat into oat mix until fully incorporated.
Stir in chocolate chips.
Preheat oven to 180c and line a tray with baking paper.
Use a teaspoon to plonk small balls of the cookie dough onto the tray.
You don't need to be particularly careful with spacing.
Bake for around 15-20 minutes.
Turn the oven off and flip the cookies over in the oven so the bottoms can dry out a bit.
Enjoy.

210607.title: Chocolate Chip Treasure Cookies
ingredient_list: 1 can (14 Oz. Size) Sweetened Condensed Milk
instruction_list: Preheat oven to 375F.
Mix together the graham cracker crumbs, flour and baking powder in a small bowl.
Set aside.
In a large bowl mix together the sweetened condensed milk and Crisco.
Then stir in the coconut, chocolate chips and nuts.
Then add the crumb mixture stir till well mixed.
Drop the dough by teaspoonful onto an ungreased cookie sheet.
Bake in the preheated oven for 9-10 minutes.

999811.title: Saucer-Sized Chocolate Chip Cookies
instruction_list: Melt 3 chocolates, stirring until smooth.
Pour into greased 9-inch metal pie pan and refrigerate until hard.
Hammer into pea-sized bits.
Store refrigerated until ready to use.
Use 1/3 cup dookie dough, flattening to a 3-1/2 to 4 round.
Bake at 375F for 16 to 18 minutes or until golden brown but not overbaked or cookies will be hard as rocks when cooled.
The cookies will look almost raw at the end of 16 minutes if you make them big enough and will continue to bake in their own heat as they cool on thesheeets a few minutes.

744962.title: Hearty Oatmeal Chocolate Chip Cookies Recipe
instruction_list: Cream together with electric mixer:

768634.title: Bacon Chocolate Chip Cookies
instruction_list: Preheat oven to 375 degrees.
Place two sheets of paper towel on a microwave safe plate.
Place half of your bacon on top of the paper towel (absorbs the grease) then more paper towel on top of the bacon.
Microwave for 5-6 minutes.
Bacon must be crisp, not chewy.
Repeat with remaining strips and set aside to cool.
Mix room temperature butter and egg until combined, then add chocolate chunk cookie mix.
Knead with hands if necessary.
Rough chop your bacon strips.
Mix bacon into cookie dough.
Roll about two tablespoons (or one for smaller cookies) into balls, (no need to make them perfect), and place them on an ungreased cookie sheet.
Bake for 12-15 minutes or until just golden around the edges.
Cool before removing from the cookie sheet.
Eat one and then give them away immediately.

301987.title: Almond Flour Chocolate Chip Cookies
instruction_list: mix it all together.
bake at 350 degrees for 7-10 minutes.
dont overbake- they are soft.
Let cool.

367738.title: Kahlua Chocolate Chip Cookies
ingredient_list: 12 cup unsalted butter or 12 cup margarine, room temp
13 cup toasted walnuts, measured after rough chop
13 cup chocolate chips, measured after rough chop
14 teaspoon freshly grated cinnamon or 12 teaspoon ground cinnamon
instruction_list: Heat oven to 350F.
In a large bowl, cream butter ( or margarine ) and sugars.
Stir in egg and vanilla extract.
Stir in walnuts and chocolate chips.
In another bowl, sift flours with baking soda, salt and cinnamon, Then add to the creamed mixture.
Mix in the Kahlua ( dough should be the consistency of playdough - If too dry - add a splash of Kahlua.
If too wet - add flour ).
Roll dough into a log and divide into 8 pieces, placing pieces on a parchment lined cookie sheet and flatten with flour dusted palm of your hand.
Bake for 10- 12 minutes or until done - ovens vary.

175151.title: Chocolate Chip Cookies
ingredient_list: 1 cup dark brown sugar, firmly packed
instruction_list: Preheat oven to 300 degrees F.
In medium bowl combine flour, soda and salt.
Mix well with wire whisk.
Set aside.
In a large bowl with an electric mixer blend sugars at meduim speed.
Add butter and mix to form a grainy paste, scraping down the sides of the bowl.
Add eggs and vanilla extract, and mix at meduim speed until just blended.
Do not overmix.
Add the flour mixture and chocolate chips, and blend at low speed until just mixed.
Do not overmix.
Drop by rounded tablespoons onto an ungreased cookie sheet, 2 inches apart.
Bake 22-24 minutes or until golden brown.
Transfer cookies immediately to a cool surface with a spatula.

879553.title: Allison's Supreme Chocolate Chip Cookies
instruction_list: Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).
Grease cookie sheets.
In a large bowl, cream together the shortening, butter, brown sugar, and white sugar until smooth.
Beat in the eggs one at a time, then stir in the vanilla and coffee liqueur.
Combine the flour, baking soda, and salt; stir into the sugar mixture.
Mix in the oats, chocolate chips, and walnuts.
Roll tablespoonfuls of dough into balls, and place them 2 inches apart onto the prepared cookie sheets.
Bake for 10 to 12 minutes in the preheated oven, or until golden.
Cool on a wire rack for a few minutes before eating!

636242.title: Thick Chocolate Chip Cookies - Jenny Toopes
ingredient_list: nuts, can be added as an optional ingredient
instruction_list: Mix butter till smooth.
Add sugars to butter, beat till creamy.
Add all dry ingredients.
Try not to over mix.
Using a small cookie scoop (or a teaspoon) drop full rounded spoons onto cookie sheet.
Bake at 350 degrees F. for about 8 minutes.

97974.title: Homestyle Vegan Chocolate Chip Cookies
instruction_list: Preheat oven to 350F (176C).
In a bowl, sift in the flour, baking powder, and baking soda.
Add the sugar and salt, and stir until well combined.
In a separate bowl, combine the maple syrup with the molasses and vanilla, then stir in the oil until well combined.
Add the wet mixture to the dry, along with the chocolate chips, and stir through until just well combined (do not over-mix).
Place large spoonfuls of the batter on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper and flatten a little.
Bake for 11 minutes, until just golden (if you bake for much longer, they will dry out).
Let cool on the sheet for no more than 1 minute (again, to prevent drying), then transfer to a cooling rack.
Note: If, as you are mixing together your batter it appears quite floury and thick, simply mix together a couple of teaspoons more canola and maple syrup and incorporate it into the batter.
Sometimes humidity, type of flour used, and other factors can affect the density of the batter and so a touch more liquid may be needed.

61628.title: Best Chocolate Chip Cookies
instruction_list: Preheat oven to 375 degrees.
Stir together flour, baking soda, and salt.
Beat butter, sugars, and vanilla in a large bowl.
Add eggs, beat well.
Gradually add flour mixture, beating after each addition.
Stir in chocolate chips.
Drop by rounded teaspoon onto a greased baking sheet.
Bake for 8 to 10 minutes or until lightly browned.

368470.title: Best Chewy Chocolate Chip Cookies
instruction_list: Preheat oven to 325F (160C).
Grease cookie sheets or line with either parchment paper or silicon baking pad (silpat).
Sift the flour, baking soda and salt together into a bowl; set aside.
In a medium bowl, cream together the melted butter and sugars until well blended.
Beat in the vanilla, egg, and egg yolk until light and creamy about 5 minutes using an electric mixer.
Slowly incorporate the flour mixture using a wooden spoon until just blended, do not overmix.
Fold in the chocolate chips.
Chill the dough for about 30 minutes to one hour, then drop 1/4 cup at a time onto the prepared cookie sheets.
Space the cookies with at least 3 inches between each cookie to allow them to spread.
Bake for 15 to 17 minutes in the preheated oven, or until the edges are lightly browned.
Check the cookies after 7 or 8 minutes and rotate the baking sheet for even baking.
Cool on baking sheets for a few minutes before transferring to wire racks to cool completely.
Store in an airtight container.
Make Ahead:
If you want to have ready-to-bake cookies, you can drop cookie dough onto baking sheets covered with wax paper or parchment paper and place in the freezer until the dough is firm.
Then, place frozen cookie dough in a plastic bag and keep frozen until ready to bake.
Expect the frozen cookies to take longer to bake than normal.

206414.title: Minty Chocolate Chip Cookies
instruction_list: Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).
Beat butter, white sugar, brown sugar, peppermint extract, vanilla extract, and salt together in a bowl using an electric mixer until smooth and creamy.
Beat eggs into butter mixture until well incorporated.
Whisk flour, cocoa powder, and baking soda together in a bowl; gradually add to creamed butter mixture, beating until dough is well blended.
Fold chocolate chips into dough.
Drop dough by rounded teaspoons onto a baking sheet.
Bake in the preheated oven until cookies are set in the middle, 8 to 10 minutes.
Cool cookies on the baking sheet for about 5 minutes before transferring to a wire rack to cool completely.

963600.title: Jerome's Chocolate Chip Cookies
instruction_list: Cream sugars, butter and margarine.
Blend in eggs.
Sift together salt, baking soda and flour in another bowl.
Blend flour mixture into the butter mixture.
Stir in nuts and chocolate chips.
Drop by teaspoonfuls onto greased cookie sheets.
Bake in preheated 350F for about 12 minutes or until pale golden.

29329.title: Super Chewy Chocolate Chip Cookies
instruction_list: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. and line a cookie sheet with a silpat liner or parchment paper.
Cream your butter and sugars in a stand mixer until light and fluffy, a good 2 minutes.
Add egg then vanilla beating to combine.
Add flour, cornstarch, baking soda, salt then chocolate chips, mixing until combined.
With cookie scoop, scoop dough onto prepared cookie sheet.
Press dough down to flatten slightly.
Bake for 10-12 minutes until baked through.
10 minutes will be softer cookies, 12 minutes will be browned.
Let cool for 10 minutes on baking sheet before transferring to cooling rack.
Serve with milk.

811420.title: Gluten Free Chocolate Chip Cookies
ingredient_list: 13 cup 60% cocoa dark chocolate bar, chopped
instruction_list: Preheat the oven to 350EsF and prepare a cookie sheet with parchment or a silpat liner.
Cream the butter with the white and brown sugar until light and fluffy.
Add the egg and the vanilla and mix until evenly distributed.
Mix together all the flours, the xanthan gum, and the salt with a whisk.
Add them gradually to the mixer allowing them to incorporate after each addition.
Add a tsp of hot water to dissolve the baking soda and add it to the mixer.
Use a spatula to make sure you get it all out.
Add the chocolate chips and the chopped chocolate and mix until well combined.
I use an ice cream scoop to measure my cookies so they're uniform.
With the scoop I use I get about 18 cookies from this recipe.
I find this to be the perfect amount for a quick craving.
Bake for 10 minutes, then rotate, and bake for 4 more minutes.
Gluten Free tends not to brown up that much.
The first few times I overbaked them.
Once they've gotten that perfect regular golden brown, for gluten free that probably means they'll be a little crisp.
So er on the side of 2 minutes less than the degree of brown you'd like to see for that perfect soft, chewy center.
And remember all ovens vary, so you'll find the perfect time for your oven with practice.
When done, allow to sit for a few minutes then move to a cooling rack to finish cooling.

105139.title: Ultimate Chocolate Chip Cookies Recipe
instruction_list: Heat oven to 375 degrees.
Cream butter flavor Crisco, brown sugar, lowfat milk and vanilla in large bowl.
Blend till creamy.
Blend in egg.
Combine flour, salt and baking soda.
Add in to creamed mix, gradually.
Stir in chocolate chips and nuts.
Drop rounded tablespoonfuls (about 2 measuring Tbsp.)
of dough 3 inches apart on ungreased baking sheet.
Bake at 375 degrees for 8 to 10 min for chewy cookies (they will look light and moist).
Don't over bake; 11 to 13 min for crisp cookies.
Cold on baking sheet for 2 min.
Remove to cooling rack.
3 dozen 3 inch cookies.

406958.title: Autumn Joy! Chocolate Marron Mousse
ingredient_list: 90 grams Chesetnut paste (I used Sabaton brand)
3 grams Gelatin (soaked with 1 tablespoon of water)
instruction_list: Sift the ingredients marked and transfer to a bowl.
Add the egg and stir together until the consistency thickens.
Mix the egg white and sugar with an electric mixer.
Add melted butter into the bowl from Step 1.
Add half of the meringue from Step 2 into the bowl in Step 3 and combine.
Then transfer to the remaining meringue and mix well.
Line a baking tray with a 28x28 cm sheet of baking paper.
Pour in the mixture and sprinkle almonds on top.
Bake in a preheated 375F/190C oven for 10 minutes.
Once baked, let it cool down completely.
Cut into the shape of your mold.
The pan is 15 cm in diameter and 6 cm in height, so I cut out a 3 cm strip to go around the edges of the pan.
The strip of biscuit should wrap all around the mold without spaces in between.
Press the remaining biscuit into the base of the mold.
Then chill the mold in the fridge.
(I covered it first with clear plastic film, although you can't see it.)
Make the mousse.
Beat heavy cream for the chocolate and marron mousse with an electric mixer.
Please be careful not to over-whip the cream.
Refer to the picture.
For chocolate mousse: Melt the chocolate in a double boiler or in the microwave.
Once the chocolate is melted, add 70 g of whipped heavy cream and combine.
Pour the mixture into the mold from Step 8 and chill again in the fridge.
For marron mousse: Pour milk and sugar into a mug and microwave for 50 seconds.
When the sugar dissolves, it is ready.
Pour the marron paste into a bowl and add Step 12 little by little.
Also add the rum.
Melt the gelatin in the microwave and add a little of the mixture from Step 13.
Then mix with the rest of Step 13.
Pour in the remaining whipped cream and combine.
Transfer this to the mold and chill in the fridge once again.
Finally remove the mousse from the mold and decorate as you like.

910088.title: Chocolate Mousse
instruction_list: Mince the chocolate, add it to a small amount of the heavy cream and microwave at 600W for 1 minute.
Immerse the bowl containing the chocolate in ice water to cool it a little!
Once it's cooled, add the remaining heavy cream and whip.
Here is a white chocolate version of this recipe -

263713.title: Instant Chocolate Mousse - Nigella Lawson
ingredient_list: 9 ounces best quality semisweet chocolate, chopped into small pieces
14 cup hot water, from a recently boiled kettle
instruction_list: Put the marshmallows, butter, chocolate and water in a heavy-based saucepan.
Put the saucepan on the stove, over heat, though keep it fairly gentle, to melt, stirring every now and again.
Remove from the heat.
Meanwhile whip the cream with the vanilla until thick and then fold into the cooling chocolate mixture until you have a smooth, cohesive mixture.
Pour or scrape into 4 or 6 glasses or small dishes and chill until you want to eat.
The sooner the better!

660282.title: Chocolate Mousse
ingredient_list: 100 g sweet chocolate or 100 g semisweet chocolate, melted
instruction_list: Beat the soft butter into the smoothly melted chocolate.
One by one, beat in the egg yolks.
Beat the cream over ice until it leaves slight peaks on the surface.
Beat the egg whites until they form soft peaks.
While beating, sprinkle in the sugar a little at a time and continue beating until stiff shining peaks are formed.
Fold in the chocolate mixture carefully and then fold in the whipped cream.
Put the mousse into individual dishes.
Cover and chill for several hours.
Decorate the mousse with swirls of whipped cream or serve separately, if desired.
Make the mousse extra special by adding to the topping few handmade chocolate leaves and a quarter segment of orange dipped in sugar.

301172.title: Chocolate Mousse
ingredient_list: 4 whole Eggs, Whites And Yolks Separated, Divided
3/4 cups Instant Sugar (I Used Extra Fine Berry Sugar)
1/4 cups Orange Liqueur (I Used Triple Sec But I Have Also Used Grand Marnier)
6 ounces, weight Softened Unsalted Butter, Cut Into Cubes
1/4 cups Finely Diced Glazed Orange Peel (optional, I Have Never Used This)
2 cups Lightly Whipped Sweetened Whipped Cream
instruction_list: With a whisk beat the egg yolks and sugar together in a 3-quart porcelain or stainless steel bowl until the mixture is thick, pale yellow and falls back upon itself forming a slowly dissolving ribbon.
Beat in the orange liqueur.
Then set the bowl over a not-quite-simmering pot of water making sure the bowl is not touching the water and continue to beat for 3-4 minutes until the mixture is foamy and too hot to touch it.
Then place it over a bowl of cold water and beat for 3-4 minutes until the mixture is cool and again forms the ribbon.
It will have the consistency of mayonnaise.
Melt the chocolate with the coffee over a pot of simmering water (the same way you did above).
Once melted, remove from heat and beat in the butter with a wooden spoon a bit at a time, to make a smooth cream.
Beat the chocolate into the egg yolks and sugar mixture, then beat in the optional orange peel.
Put the egg whites and salt into a bowl and beat until soft peaks are formed.
Then sprinkle on the granulated sugar and beat until stiff peaks are formed.
Stir one fourth of the egg white mixture into the chocolate mixture.
Then fold in the rest.
Turn the mixture into serving dishes, dessert cups, petits pots, etc and refrigerate for at least 2 hours or overnight.
Pass the whipped cream separately when serving the mousse.
What a magnificent creation!!
Excerpted from Mastering the Art of French Cooking by Julia Child.

151548.title: Chocolate Mousse Royale
instruction_list: Melt chocolate in top of double boiler, slowly, over hot (not boiling) water.
Combine water, sugar and vanilla and cook syrup until it reaches 230F on a candy thermometer.
Set syrup aside and let it cool to a warm temperature; around 125F.
Meanwhile, whip the cream until it is stiff; refrigerate.
Place egg yolks in mixer bowl and beat them for 1 minute.
Slowly add warm syrup, beating all the while until yolks are thick and cool; approximately 5 minutes.
Slowly beat in the chocolate until it is blended in the yolk mixture.
Slowly beat in the cream until it is thoroughly mixed.
Pour mixture into 8 long stem glasses or pretty desert dishes.
Chill until firm.

390492.title: Chocolate Mousse
instruction_list: Mash it up or blend it until it is smooth, chill and serve.

689499.title: Healthy Chocolate Mousse Spread (Vegan)
ingredient_list: 12 cup kidney bean, cooked and drained
11 dates, soaked in water for 6 hours
instruction_list: Place all ingredients in the bowl of your blender or food processor and process into a smooth paste.
Depending on how moist your beans are, you might have to add a bite of the date soaking water to reach the desired consistency.
Keep in mind that it will thicken up a tad during refrigeration.
Keep in the fridge for one night or several hours, then dig in!

20152.title: Macrobiotic Tofu and Banana Chocolate Mousse
instruction_list: Put the lightly drained tofu, soy milk, bananas, cocoa powder, and maple syrup in a blender, and blend until smooth.
(I use 2 tablespoons of maple syrup.)
Heat the water and kanten powder in a pot, bring to boil, then add the blended mixture a little at a time.
Turn off the heat just before it comes to a boil.
Pour the mixture into a mold or glass, then chill in the refrigerator until it sets.
Adjust the amount of maple syrup to taste.

906749.title: Chocolate Almond Frozen Mousse
ingredient_list: 2 Tablespoons Strong Brewed Coffee, Completely Cooled
instruction_list: Allow Cool Whip to thaw on the counter for ten to fifteen minutes.
Gently stir in cool coffee until combined.
Melt Hershey bar in the microwave for 30 to 45 seconds.
Allow to cool for a couple of minutes, then stir into Cool Whip mixture.
Since the Cool Whip is cold, it will solidify the candy bar in tiny particles.
Serve soft or refreeze and serve as an ice-cream type treat.

742796.title: Tofu Chocolate Mousse
instruction_list: Blend tofu and bananas together in food processer until smooth.
Add melted chocolate and blend until color is dark.
Before the mousse cools, portion into 6 0z.
martini glasses and then store in refrigerator.
Chill about 40 minutes before serving.

591829.title: Jello Chocolate Mousse W/Tofu
ingredient_list: 1 (1 1/2 ounce) packagejello chocolate pudding mix (four 1/2 cup servings) or 1 (1 1/2 ounce) package vegetarian chocolate pudding mix
instruction_list: Drain tofu(prep time 10 min.
)and place in medium or large bowl.
Add pudding mix.
Mix until smooth.
An electric mixer on a medium setting works well.
Place in four containers and chill for ten minutes.
Different flavors may be used.
Garnish with a cherry or other favorite fruit.

279490.title: Chocolate Mousse
instruction_list: Blend everything and serve with strawberries

117822.title: Mexican Chocolate Pumpkin Mousse
instruction_list: Combine all ingredients EXCEPT NUTS in blender/food processor.
Blend until completely smooth.
Spoon into cups (or pie shells) and chill for 1 hour.
Garnish with a sprinkle of cinnamon and nuts.

829607.title: Vegan Chocolate Mousse Smoothie
ingredient_list: Shredded Coconut And Pecans, For Garnish
instruction_list: Place all ingredients into blender and blend until smooth and creamy.
Top with coconut shreds and pecans for garnish!

921897.title: Vegan Chocolate Coconut Milk Mousse
instruction_list: In a small pot, warm the almond milk over medium heat until it begins to steam.
Remove the pot from the fire and add the dark chocolate.
Stir the chocolate until it has melted.
If necessary, return the pot to the fire to help it along.
Once melted, allow it to cool slightly.
Add the milk mixture, tofu and coconut milk to a blender and process until it is smooth.
Transfer the mixture to a bowl or serving glasses and chill for 3 to 4 hours, until set.

662288.title: Vegan Chocolate Mousse
instruction_list: Melt vegan chocolate chips on stove top until creamy.
Add silken tofu and melted chocolate to blender or food processor and blend until well combined.
Divide chocolate mousse between 4 glasses and garnish with berries and sprigs of mint.

562789.title: White Chocolate Orange Mousse
ingredient_list: 1 pkg. (4-serving size) JELL-O White Chocolate Flavor Sugar Free Fat Free Instant Pudding
2 cups thawed COOL WHIP LITE Whipped Topping
1 tsp. grated orange zest Safeway 1 lb For $0.79 thru 02/09
instruction_list: Pour milk into medium bowl.
Add pudding mix.
Beat with wire whisk 1 minute.
Gently stir in whipped topping and orange zest.
Spoon into dessert dishes.
Refrigerate until ready to serve.

252917.title: Chocolate Chia Seed Mousse
ingredient_list: 1 cup Classic Coconut Milk (BPA-free Can- Native Forest Brand)
instruction_list: Combine all ingredients in a food processor and process until creamy.
Refrigerate for 45 minutes to an hour to set.
Note: Grind chia seeds in a small coffee grinder (or purchase pre-ground seeds).

764072.title: Kit's Chocolate Mousse
instruction_list: Melt the chocolate over hot water.
Let it cool until only warm.
While the chocolate cools, whip the cream until it forms medium-stiff peaks.
Do not overbeat or the mousse will lose some of its smooth, light texture.
Separate 4 of the eggs and set the whites aside.
Combine yolks with the 2 remaining whole eggs in the bowl of an electric mixer.
Beat until eggs are thick and lemon colored, around 5 minutes.
While the yolks are beating, place the 4 egg whites in a clean copper or stainless steel bowl and whisk, preferably by hand, until the whites start to stiffen.
Sprinkle on the confectioners' sugar and beat until you have firm peaks.
Working quickly, add the cooled melted chocolate and a scoop of the whipped cream to the egg yolks.
Stir until smooth, then add the remaining cream.
When it is fully incorporated, add the liqueur and vanilla, then fold in the whites until just blended.
This mousse can be poured into small individual serving dishes or into 1 larger dessert dish.
Chill at least 4 hours before serving.
(Chilling it overnight intensifies the flavor.)
The mousse may be frozen for up to 2 weeks.
Remove from the freezer and let it sit in the refrigerator overnight before serving.
VARIATION: Make a Brownie Cookie Crust from the Brownie Cookies recipe, then fill it with the mousse.
Chill for 4 hours, then pipe whipped cream on top.

211392.title: Bittersweet Chocolate Mousse a L'orange
ingredient_list: 2 (12 1/3 ounce) packages lowfat silken tofu, drained
instruction_list: Combine the first 7 ingredients in a blender or food processor; process mixture until smooth.
Place chopped chocolate in a small microwave-safe bowl.
Microwave at HIGH 1 minute or until almost melted; stir until smooth.
Add chocolate to tofu mixture; process until smooth.
Divide orange sections evenly among 6 bowls or parfait glasses; top each serving with 1/2 cup mousse.
Cover and chill at least 1 hour.

867646.title: Eggless Chocolate Mousse
ingredient_list: 10 ounces semi- sweet chocolate, you can substitute bitter- sweet if you prefer
1 1/4 cups heavy cream, 1 cup chilled and whipped to form stiff peaks, 1/4 reserved
instruction_list: In a metal bowl over a pot of simmering water (a double boiler) melt the chocolate, butter and vanilla.
Be sure not to burn so pull it off the heat when there are few small pieces still visible.
Continue to stir off the heat until smooth and let cool to room temperature.
Slightly warm the 1/4 cup of cream and add the gelatin.
This should not be hot just very slightly warm.
Let bloom (melt) for about 10 minutes.
Fold into the chocolate mixture.
Then fold the whipped cream into the chocolate mixture until just incorporated.
Chill until ready to serve.
If you want to serve this in individual glasses, place the mousse into the glasses before chilling.

309402.title: Low Fat Dark Chocolate Mousse
ingredient_list: 6 ounces high quality bittersweet chocolate, finely chopped
1 tablespoon espresso or 1 tablespoon strong coffee
instruction_list: In a food processor or blender puree the tofu until it is smooth.
Put the chopped chocolate, cocoa powder, water and brandy in the top of a double boiler or a heat-proof bowl.
Place over a pot containing 1-inch of barely simmering water.
Stir frequently, until melted and smooth.
Remove from heat.
Mix in 1/2 cup of sugar, a little at a time, until smooth.
Add the chocolate mixture to the tofu and puree until well blended.
Spoon the mousse into individual serving dishes or one large serving dish.
Cover and refrigerate for at least 1 hour.
Whip the cream with an electric mixer.
When the cream is almost completely whipped, add the remaining 1/2 teaspoon of sugar and finish whipping.
Top each serving with a dollop of whipped cream and a sprinkle of chocolate shavings and serve.

68268.title: Chocolate Mousse
instruction_list: In a blender, puree the tofu to a smooth paste.
Add the melted chocolate and blend thoroughly.
Pour the mousse into six individual bowls and chill.

452660.title: Chocolate Lover's Mousse
instruction_list: In small cup, sprinkle gelatin over cold water.

Let stand 1 minute to soften add boiling water Stir til gelatin is completly dissolved and mixture is clear cool slightly In small mixing bowl, stir together sugar& cocoa; add whipping cream& vanilla Beat on medium speed of mixture, scraping bottom of bowl occasionally, til mixture is stiff Pour in gelatin mixture; beat til well blended Spoon into serving dishes or champagne glasses Refrigerate about 30 minutes Garnish with raspberries, chocolate curls or miniature chips.

823471.title: Easy Faux Chocolate Mousse
instruction_list: Mix mascarpone cheese, whipping cream, and vanilla extract in a bowl.
Melt chocolate chips in the top of a double boiler over simmering water, stirring frequently and scraping down the sides with a rubber spatula to avoid scorching.
Fold melted chocolate into the mascarpone cheese mixture.
Refrigerate until set, 1 to 2 hours.

763193.title: Chocolate Toblerone Mousse
ingredient_list: 1 teaspoon gelatine dissolved 1/4 cup boiling water
instruction_list: Beat Philly*, sugar and cream until smooth.
Add egg yolks, gelatine mixture and melted chocolate, mixing until well combined.
Whip egg whites to soft peaks, gently fold into chocolate mixture with Toblerone*.
Pour into 6 small coffee cups or small dishes and chill for 4 hours.
Decorate with extra chocolate.

877343.title: Easy Chocolate Mousse
ingredient_list: 4 peaks (1/2 of 100-g bar) Toblerone Swiss Milk Chocolate
1/2 cup thawed Cool Whip Whipped Topping
instruction_list: Microwave chocolate in medium microwaveable bowl on HIGH 1 min.
or until melted.
Cool 1 min.
Add Cool Whip; stir gently with whisk until well blended.
Refrigerate 5 min.

80623.title: Favorite Chocolate Mousse
ingredient_list: 1-1/2 pkg. (4 oz. each) BAKER'S Semi-Sweet Chocolate (6 oz.), broken into pieces
1 tub (8 oz.) COOL WHIP Whipped Topping, thawed
instruction_list: Sprinkle gelatine over milk in medium saucepan; let stand 1 min.
Cook on low heat 3 min.
or until gelatine is completely dissolved, stirring constantly.
Add chopped chocolate; continue cooking until chocolate is completely melted and mixture is well blended, stirring constantly.
Blend in vanilla.
Place saucepan in large bowl of ice water.
Stir chocolate mixture 3 min.
or until slightly thickened.
Pour into large bowl.
Gently stir in whipped topping.
Spoon evenly into 12 dessert glasses.
Refrigerate 4 hours or until chilled.
Store leftovers in refrigerator.

170311.title: CHOCOLATE MOUSSE
ingredient_list: 1 12 cups thawed Cool Whip Topping, divided
instruction_list: BEAT pudding mix and milk in medium bowl with whisk 2 minute Stir in 1 cup COOL WHIP.
SPOON into serving bowl or 6 individual dessert dishes.
REFRIGERATE 1 hour.
Top with remaining COOL WHIP just before serving.
Garnish with chocolate curls.

580232.title: Chocolate Fluff Pie
instruction_list: crust: Combine all crust ingredients.
Press into a 10-inch glass pie pan.
Bake 15 minutes.
Let cool on wire rack.
filling: Melt chocolate in double boiler with marshmallows, sugar, salt and milk.
Stir until melted.
Remove from heat.
Beat cream cheese until smooth then beat in chocolate mixture; mixing well.
Add vanilla extract.
Set aside to cool.
Fold in Cool Whip.
Put into cooled pie shell.
Garnish with shaved chocolate.
Refrigerate overnight.

578509.title: Triple Chocolate S'more Pie
instruction_list: For the crust: Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F.
Spray the inside of a 9-inch pie pan with non-stick cooking spray.
In a bowl, combine graham cracker crumbs, sugar, and melted butter.
Press mixture firmly into sprayed pie pan, covering bottom and sides.
Bake for 6 to 8 minutes.
Set aside to cool.
For filling: In a microwave safe bowl, combine milk chocolate chips, 1/2 cup condensed milk, and 1/2 teaspoon vanilla.
Microwave for 2 minutes on medium (50 percent) power.
OR combine milk chocolate chips, 1/2 cup condensed milk, and 1/2 tsp.
vanilla and melt in a double boiler.
Stir until all chips are melted and pour into bottom of cooled crust.
Set in refrigerator while preparing second layer.
For second layer, repeat above process using the vanilla chips.
Pour over milk chocolate layer.
Set in refrigerator while preparing third layer.
For third layer repeat above process using the dark chocolate chips.
Pour over white chocolate layer.
Preheat the broiler.
Evenly cover top with miniature marshmallows.
Place under broiler for a few minutes just until marshmallows are lightly browned.
Refrigerate at least 1 hour.

354795.title: Chocolate Pie
ingredient_list: 1 whole Pie Crust, Baked And Cooled (or Can Use Oreo Or Graham Cracker Crust)
6- 1/2 ounces, weight Bittersweet Chocolate, Chopped Finely
instruction_list: Combine the sugar, cornstarch, and salt in a medium saucepan.
Stir or whisk together.
Pour in milk and egg yolks, and whisk together.
Stir over medium heat until the mixture just barely comes to a boil and becomes thick, about 6-8 minutes (maybe less, maybe more; just watch it!)
The second it starts to bubble and thicken (note: It should be thick like pudding!)
remove it from the heat.
Add the chocolate, vanilla, and butter, and stir until everything is beautifully combined.
Pour the pudding into the pie crust (if there is extra, spoon it into small dishes) and place in the fridge to chill for 4 hours uncovered.
Cut into slices and serve with whipped cream!

49544.title: Chocolate Cloud Pie
ingredient_list: 1-1/4 cups finely crushed chocolate wafer cookies (about 20 wafers or 1/2 of 9-oz. pkg.)
1/4 cup (1/2 stick) butter or margarine, melted
2 pkg. (8 oz. each) PHILADELPHIA Cream Cheese, softened
1-1/2 pkg. (4 oz. each) BAKER'S Semi-Sweet Chocolate (6 oz.), broken into pieces, melted, cooled slightly
instruction_list: Preheat oven to 325F.
Mix wafer crumbs, granulated sugar and butter; press firmly onto bottom and up side of 9-inch pie plate.
Bake 10 min.
Beat cream cheese, brown sugar and vanilla with electric mixer on medium speed until well blended.
Add eggs, 1 at a time, mixing well after each addition.
Blend in chocolate; pour into crust.
Bake 35 min.
Cool completely.
Store leftover pie in refrigerator.

497611.title: Chocolate Silk Pecan Pie
instruction_list: Heat oven to 350F In small bowl, combine sugar, corn syrup,butter, salt and eggs; beat 1 minute at medium speed.
Stir in pecans.
Pour into pie crust.
Bake 350F for 40 to 55 minutes or until center of pie is puffed and golden brown.
(I fold a 3" band of aluminum foil and place loosely around edge of crust, folding over top to keep edges from browning too quickly).
Cool 1 hour.
While pecan layer is cooling, combile all chocolate filling ingredients in a food processor or blender.
Process for about 1 minute or until smooth.
Refrigerate about 1 1/2 hours until mixture is slightly thickened, but not set.
You want to be able to pour it.
Stir gently and pour over cooled pecan layer.
Refrigerate until firm, about 1 hour.
In small bowl, beat topping ingredients until stiff peaks form.
Spoon or pipe over filling (it looks especially pretty piped just around outer edge).
Garnish with chocolate curls.
Store in refrigerator.

287520.title: Dark Chocolate Brownie Pie
ingredient_list: 1 (18 ounce) box brownie mix (Dark chocolate good, not the fudge kind...reg. size brownie mix)
1 (21 ounce) can cherry pie filling (please note that the oz listed here is not right...just given for recipezaar..it's a reg. size found)
instruction_list: Heat oven to 350 degrees.
In a bowl mix brownie mix and cherry pie filling.
Pour into pie shell.
Bake 350 1hr.

864366.title: Cappuccino Pie in Chocolate Cookie Crust
ingredient_list: 2 qt. MAXWELL HOUSE Caffeinated Coffee, brewed single strength, chilled
2 pkg. JELL-O Vanilla Whip N Chill Mousse
instruction_list: Place coffee and mousse mix in bowl of electric mixer fitted with wire whip attachment.
Beat on low speed 30 seconds or just until moistened.
Scrape bowl.
Beat on medium speed an additional 5 to 8 minutes or until light and fluffy.
Spoon filling evenly into crusts.
Refrigerate until ready to serve.

551920.title: No-Bake Strawberry Pie With Chocolate Chunks
ingredient_list: 2 cups raw almonds or 2 cups pecans
2 teaspoons fresh lemon juice, freshly squeezed
1 dark chocolate bar, chunked (preferably from a good, organic, fair-trade bar, to taste) (optional)
instruction_list: Soak the pitted dates for the filling in warm water for 10 minutes and then drain.
Place the nuts in a food processor and grind until theyre a coarse meal.
Add the dates (for the crust) and process until thoroughly combined.
Press the mixture into a non-stick or very lightly oiled pie plate or spring form pan.
Arrange 4 cups of the sliced strawberries on top of the crust and set aside.
In a food processor or blender, combine the remaining 1 cup of strawberries with the 5 soaked dates and lemon juice.
Puree until smooth.
Pour the sauce mixture over strawberries.
Arrange the chocolate chunks on the top of the sauce (optional), and refrigerate the pie for 1 hour before serving.
This will help the pie set and will be perfect for slicing.

765834.title: mint chocolate and oreo pie
ingredient_list: 6 oz box of Andes chocolate mints (28 pieces) finely chopped
instruction_list: In a bowl combine crushed oreos, 1/2 the cool whip, and 1/2 of the mints.
Spoon mixture into pie crust.
Top with the rest of the cool whip and chopped mints
Chill and serve

448351.title: Chocolate Pudding Pie
ingredient_list: 1 (5.9 ounce) package instant chocolate pudding mix
1 (8 ounce) container frozen whipped topping, thawed
instruction_list: Make instant pudding according to directions on box.
Dump pudding into pie crust.
Spread whipped topping on top of the pudding.
Refrigerate until not too gooey.
Garnish with gummy worms.

15121.title: Grandma Chunkies Chocolate Pie Filling
ingredient_list: 2 bars Large (8 Oz.) Hershey Candy Bar (Milk Chocolate)
instruction_list: Melt Candy bar and marshmallows in milk over low fire until smooth.
Cool.
Add 1-9 oz Cool Whip into chocolate mixture
Pour into a baked pie shell and refrigerate until ready to serve.
Spoon a large helping of Cool Whip on your slice of pie!
(I like to add chocolate sprinkles too.)

952906.title: Chocolate Candy Bar Pie
ingredient_list: 6 whole 1.55 Oz. Hershey's Chocolate Bars, With Or Without Almonds
1 whole 9" Graham Cracker Or Cookie Pie Crust (a Baked Pastry Pie Shell May Be Substituted)
instruction_list: Begin by melting the chocolate bars over a double boiler, stirring until smooth.
(I dont own a double boiler, so I use a mixing bowl over a sauce pan.
It works like a charm.)
Once melted, if using the chocolate bars without almonds, slightly crush 1/4 cup slivered almonds and mix into the melted chocolate.
(If you dont like almonds, or are like me, forgetful, skip the almonds altogether.)
Next, add the whipped topping, gently mix and pour into prepared pie shell.
If using the almonds, evenly spread the remaining 1/4 cup of slivered almonds on the top of the pie.
Cover and refrigerate for about four or five hours, or until firm.
If needed, speed up the firming process by putting covered pie in freezer for about an hour, then refrigerate for another two hours.

765974.title: Extra - Easy Chocolate Pie
ingredient_list: 1 (8 ounce) container frozen whipped topping, Thawed
instruction_list: Combine Chocolate and water in a microwave-safe bowl, Microwave at Medium (50% power) 1 1/2 to 2 minutes; stir until smooth.
Fold in whipping topping; pour into crust.
Cover and chill at least 8 hours before serving.
Opt.
Toppings: Shredded Chocolate, nuts, and cool whip.

687713.title: Triple-Layer Chocolate Pie
ingredient_list: 2 pkg. (3.9 oz. each) JELL-O Chocolate Flavor Instant Pudding
1 tub (8 oz.) COOL WHIP Whipped Topping, thawed, divided
instruction_list: Beat pudding mixes and milk in large bowl with whisk 2 min.
(Pudding will be thick.)
Spread 1-1/2 cups pudding onto bottom of crust.
Stir half the COOL WHIP into remaining pudding; spread over layer in crust.
Top with remaining COOL WHIP.
Refrigerate 3 hours or until firm.

313058.title: Brownie Pie Kathy's Absolute Favorite Chocolate Thing Recipe
ingredient_list: 1 x fudge-type brownie mix ice cream lightly sweetened whipped cream chocolate syrup
instruction_list: Fudge-type brownie mix (this is a dense, chewy bar-type cookie with nuts) made according to package directions.
Grease a 9-inch pie tin, and pour the brownie fold in the pie tin.
Bake according to package directions.
Remove the brownie pie from the oven, cold slightly and cut into 10 wedges (the wedges seem small, but this is RICH.
Top each wedge with a scoop of ice cream, a spoonful or possibly two of lightly sweetened whipped cream, and drizzle with chocolate syrup.
Serve immediately.
Any unused pie may be wrapped air-tight, and re-heated later.
Kathy in Bryan, TX...
The cat who doesn't act finicky soon loses control of his owner.

555620.title: Whole Banana Chocolate Pie
instruction_list: Top the pastry sheets with minced chocolate and banana.
Moisten the edges with water.
Roll out the top pie sheet with a rolling pin, make small cuts in the surface and place on top of the banana.
Push the edges together with a fork.
Coat the surface with beaten egg for the glaze.
Bake for 20 minutes in an oven preheated to 190 degrees C, and it's done!

826926.title: No Bake " Chocolate Chip Cookie Pie " ( made with Chips Ahoy)...
ingredient_list: 1 -13oz. package chocolate chip cookies ( crunchy ones , not soft ones)
instruction_list: Set aside 2 cookies to crumble on top.Place milk in a measuring cup.
Dunk 8 cookies, 1 cookie at a time in the milk.layer in bottom of graham cracker crust.
Dunk cookies quickly or they will absorb to much milk..Spread 1/3 of cool whip evenly over cookies.
Dip 10 or 11 more cookies.
One at a time in the milk & place in a single layer over cool whip.
Spread 1/3 more of the cool whip over them.
Repeat to create one more layer.& one more layer of cool whip.
You Will use all cookies but 2.
Crumble reserved 2 cookies over the top.Chill at least 8 Hours.Before serving.
( I smashed my 2 cookies in a small plastic bag with the rolling pin).

798774.title: Vegan Chocolate Mocha Pie
instruction_list: In a small saucepan, combine water and agar-agar flakes and bring to a boil.
Gently simmer until agar has dissolved completely, about 5 minutes.
Add espresso and stir until dissolved.
Cool slightly.
In a food processor or blender, blend tofu, maple syrup, cocoa powder, vanilla, salt and cooled espresso mixture until completely smooth.
Pour into the prepared pie shell.
Refrigerate for several hours or overnight until firm.
Serve topped with non-dairy topping.

598034.title: Good Chocolate Pie
instruction_list: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
Place margarine in a small glass bowl and melt in microwave for 45 seconds, or until liquid.
Set aside to cool.
In a large mixing bowl, beat together eggs, sugar, cooled margarine, and vanilla extract.
In a small bowl, sift together flour, cornstarch, and cocoa powder.
Stir into egg mixture until smooth.
Mix in evaporated milk, stirring until all ingredients are thoroughly combined.

Bake in preheated oven for 40 to 45 minutes, until set in center.

476080.title: Old Fashioned Chocolate Pie
ingredient_list: 2 eggs, separated (yolks for filling, whites for meringue)
instruction_list: Preheat oven to 350.
In large saucepan, mix together sugar, cocoa, and flour.
Add milk and cook over low heat until thick.
Beat egg yolks well.
Add egg yolks and butter to milk mixture and cook one minute more.
Cool.
Pour into baked pie shell.
Beat eggs whites until stiff, adding 3 Tbsp of sugar graduaally as you beat.
When stiff peaks form, gently pour on the COOLED filling.
Bake in a 350 oven until meringue is light golden brown on its peaks.
Enjoy.

681627.title: Chocolate Turtle Pie
ingredient_list: 34 cup milk chocolate or 34 cup semisweet chocolate morsel
instruction_list: Combine eggs, sweetened condensed milk and butter; mix well.
Stir in nuts and morsels.
Pour into pie crust.
Bake at 350 for 35-40 minutes or until a knife inserted near center comes out clean.
Cool completely on a wire rack.
Drizzle with caramel topping.

818702.title: Easy Chocolate Silk Pie
ingredient_list: 1 12 cups chocolate graham cracker crumbs (375 ml)
instruction_list: Combine crumbs and sugar.
Add maragarine, blend well.
Press into bottom and sides of a 9-inch (23 cm) greased pie plate.
Bake at 375 degrees F (190 degrees C) for 8 minutes; cool.
Cream margarine with sugar.
Beat in eggs and vanilla.
Add melted chocolate; mix well and place bowl in freezer 5 minutes or until mixture is slightly stiff.
Prepare desert topping mix as directed on package.
Beat in chilled chocolate mixture until light and smooth.
Pour into prepared Crumb Crust.
Chill until set, at least 1 hour.

918032.title: Easy Chocolate Pie
instruction_list: Mix pudding and pie filling with milk for 1 minute on low speed.
Add slightly softened ice cream.
Mix and pour into pie shell.
Top with Cool Whip.
Refrigerae for approximately 4 hours before serving.
Shaved chocolate sprinkled on top is a nice touch.

842141.title: Chocolate Blender Pie
instruction_list: Mix eggs, sugar,milk, and cocoa in blender for 1 minute.
Add 1/2 stick melted butter, pinch of salt, and 1 teaspoons vanilla.
Blend;pour into unbaked pie shell.
Bake at 350 degrees for 40-45 minutes.

217387.title: Vegan Chocolate Pie
ingredient_list: 12 ounces dark chocolate (1 1/2 to 2 cups chocolate chips)
instruction_list: For crust, combine all ingredients and press into a 9" pie plate; bake 12-15 minutes (until set) at 350 degrees .
For filling, blend the tofu in the blender until smooth, then add & blend everything else.
Pour filling into the crust and chill for at least 2 hours.

226564.title: Chocolate Elk Pie (Mousse Made With Silken Tofu)

1 teaspoon vanilla or 1 teaspoon almond extract
1 graham cracker crust (or what ever type crumb crust you prefer)
instruction_list: Melt chocolate in microwave, or in double boiler.
I use the microwave, it's just easier.
Place tofu in blender, and blend til smooth.
Add chocolate, and extract.
Pulse blender til mixed.
Pour into pie crust and chill about an hour.
*Note: I couldn't remember the exact weight of the tofu package.
You'll find silken tofu in the veggie section, next to where they have won ton wrappers - whatever size the silken package is, that's what I buy - and I've only ever seen one size.
They have a lite version, but I've never tried that, but would probably work.
Also, if you want a more intense chocolate flavor, just add a lil more chocolate.

917802.title: Chocolate Sin Pie

Cool.

Fourth Layer

854398.title: Easy Chocolate Pie

993346.title: Four Ingredient Chocolate Pie

836295.title: Chocolate Wafer Pie
ingredient_list: 34 cup chocolate wafer crumbs, finely ground

Spray a 9-inch pie dish with nonstick cooking spray.
In a medium bowl, beat egg whites and salt at high speed with an electric mixer until foamy.
Gradually add sugar, beating until stiff peaks form.
Gently fold in chocolate wafer crumbs, pecans and vanilla.
Spoon mixture into prepared pie dish, and bake for 30-35 minutes or until the center of pie is firm.

Spread whipped topping over pie before serving.
Garnish with grated chocolate, if desired.

591236.title: Chocolate Pudding
ingredient_list: 2 12 cups instant nonfat dry milk powder
instruction_list: Mix the dry milk powder, sugar, cornstarch, salt, and cocoa together until well blended.
It can be stored in a big airtight container or glass jar until you need it.
To use, stir mix before using to redistribute ingredients.
Measure out 2/3 cup of the pudding mix into a medium saucepan.
Add milk, vanilla and butter and cook over low heat, stirring constantly until mixture comes to a boil.

649158.title: Dark Chocolate Pudding
ingredient_list: 7 ounces dark chocolate candy bars, melted
instruction_list: In a large saucepan, combine the sugar, cornstarch and salt.
Stir in milk until smooth.
Cook and stir over medium-high heat until thickened and bubbly.

Remove from the heat.
Stir a small amount of hot mixture into egg yolks; return all to pan, stirring constantly.

472213.title: Chocolate Tapioca Pudding
instruction_list: Mix milk, salt, and tapioca in 3 quart saucepan.
Cook and stir until begins to thicken.
Separate egg yolks from whites.
Set whites aside.
Mix egg yolks, sugar, and cocoa in separate saucepan.
Heat and mix until creamy.

Remove from heat.
Beat egg whites until stiff then fold whites into tapioca mixture.

446275.title: Chocolate Pudding
instruction_list: In a saucepan, heat coconut milk and salt over medium heat.
Raise heat and sift the arrowroot powder into the pot, then whisk vigorously by hand or with a hand blender until thick.
Whisk in agave, yacon, stevia and vanilla.

870564.title: Diabetic Chocolate Pudding Recipe
instruction_list: Sift cocoa into medium saucepan to remove lumps, then fold in cornstarch and salt.
Slowly stir in lowfat milk.
Cook mix over medium heat, stirring constantly till it begins to boil and thicken.
Turn heat to low and continue cooking and stirring for 3 min.
Remove from heat and add in Equal and vanilla.
Pour into custard c. and place a sheet of plastic wrap on surface of each pudding to prevent skin from forming.
Chill.
Serves: 6.
Exchanges: 1 bread.
Calories: 69.

920112.title: Easy, Rich Chocolate Pudding
instruction_list: Melt chocolate in a saucepan or in the microwave and allow to cool slightly.
Sift cocoa, corn starch, sugar and salt together in a large, heavy-bottomed saucepan.
Slowly whisk in the half and half, then the egg yolks, then the milk.
Stir in the chocolate (it will look curdled and clumped, but will melt together with cooking).
Bring mixture to a boil over medium-high heat, whisking constantly and scraping the sides and bottom of the pot.
A splatter screen might be helpful here if your pot is not very deep.
As the pudding reaches the boiling point it will darken and thicken.
When it boils, reduce heat to medium and stir with a wooden spoon for about two minutes, until it has reached the appropriate pudding consistency.
Stir in butter and vanilla.
Serve warm or chilled.

720897.title: Apples and Chocolate Pudding Dip

448351.title: Chocolate Pudding Pie

107708.title: Tofu Chocolate Pudding

It will thicken.
You can pipe them into serving bowls/ramekins and serve them plain or with raspberries.

525494.title: Dairy Free and no Cook Chocolate Pudding
ingredient_list: 2 cups young coconut meat (see note) found in Asian markets
3/4 cup coconut water, at room temperature (or more, if needed to thin) from the coconut
1/2 cup maple syrup (reduce maple syrup if you want it less sweet)
1/3 cup agave nectar (cactus syrup) found in health stores
instruction_list: In a Vita-Mix or high speed blender, puree all the ingredients until completely smooth, stopping to scrape the sides as necessary.
Transfer to bowls and chill form a firmer pudding, or eat it straightaway.
Try this with raspberries and fresh mint, or chopped nuts.
Serves 4.
NOTE: The whole young coconuts generally come with the husks trimmed down, so they sit flat with a pointed top.
To open these coconuts, a cleaver is your best bet.
You can use a chefs knife, but if you do, make sure its an old, inexpensive one!
Lay the coconut on its side, securing it so that it wont roll Try not to hold the fruit with your free hand while you make the first cut (in case you have particularly bad aim!).
Holding the knife high, bring it down sharply near the top of the coconut.
The knife should sink in about 1/3 of the way, breaking through the inner shell.
Quickly set the coconut upright so as not to lose the water to the cutting board.
If you didnt succeed in breaking the inner shell, rotate the shell and try the technique again.
Drain the coconut of its water into a blender or bowl, then use the cleaver or knife to finish cutting off the top to get at the meat.
The meat will range from very thin and very soft (sometimes even with a pale purplish hue in very young coconuts), to thicker and firmer.
The firmer meat is best for recipes that call for noodles or pasta squares.

Sometimes you have to open a few before you get one with nice firm meat, but the soft meat is perfectly good for sauces and smoothies, and coconut meat freezes beautifully, so all of it is good to use.
The best way to get the firmer meat out is by using the back of a spoon to pry it from the sides of the coconut, then trim away any of the shell residue with a paring knife.
Lay the pieces of coconut flat on a cutting board and slice into 1/6 inch strips for dishes that call for coconut noodles.

476482.title: Chocolate Chip Pudding Nut Brownies Recipe

instruction_list: Follow cake mix directions.
Add in dry pudding mix.
Add in 1/2 of nuts and 1/4 chips in a bowl.
Bake 325 degree oven.
Put chips on bottom of floured square pan.
Pour on top of chips.

645213.title: Chocolate Chip Banana Nut Rice Pudding

Cook over medium heat until thick and creamy, 20-25 minutes, stirring frequently.
Remove from heeat.
Alternate layers of bananas, chocolate chips, pecans and rice pudding in parfait glasses.
Garnish with chocolate chips and pecans.

ingredient_list: 1 each chocolate pudding snack cup, low-fat

767491.title: Cream Cheese and Chocolate Pudding Parfait
instruction_list: Mix Cream Cheese according to instructions.

Alternate first cream cheese then pudding.
Do this until desired amount.

Spoon into four bowls or cups,add berries and a dollop of whipped topping if using, and serve.

268555.title: Raw Chocolate Pudding
ingredient_list: 10 fresh dates, pitted and cut in quarters
10 dried figs, stems removed, cut in quarters
instruction_list: Place the dates, figs, cocoa, nut butter (if using), vanilla, and 1 cup of water in a blender and pulse several times until the fruits begin to break down.
Blend until smooth and creamy, slowly adding water as needed for desired consistency.

144939.title: Banana Chocolate Pudding "On the Fly"
instruction_list: In a mixing bowl, gently mix bananas with honey and Grand Marnier.
Leave in refrigerator for 30 minutes.
In a small serving bowl, lay crushed graham crackers in the bottom, then bananas (with the marinade), wafer cookies, and finally the chocolate pudding.

Before serving, top it off with whipped cream.

487199.title: Chocolate Pudding With Tofu
ingredient_list: 1 (1 1/2 ounce) package sugar-free chocolate pudding mix (jello Brand)
instruction_list: blend both ingredients.
chill to desired temperature.
enjoy.

509242.title: Chocolate Crossiant Pudding

Beat eggs and sugar together then beat in the cocoa mixture.

Top edges of croissant slices should be brown.
Serve with heavy whipping cream over top.

610136.title: Mayan Spiced Chocolate Pudding

instruction_list: Whisk together 1/4 cup coconut milk and cornstarch in small bowl.
Set aside.
Combine remaining coconut milk, sugar, cinnamon, chili powder, and salt in saucepan, and bring to a simmer over medium heat.
Whisk 1/4 cup hot mixture into cornstarch mixture to form slurry.
Whisk slurry into hot mixture, and cook 3 minutes, or until thickened, whisking constantly.
Remove from heat, and whisk in chocolate and vanilla.
Transfer to metal bowl, and set in larger bowl filled with ice and water.
Whisk occasionally to cool.
Serve sprinkled with pinch of chili powder.

99887.title: Chocolate Ganache Pudding
ingredient_list: 2 whole Medium-sized Ripe Hass Avocados, Peeled And Pitted
2 Tablespoons Chocolate Coconut Butter, Such As Cacao Bliss

Process until no lumps remain, scraping down the sides of the food processor bowl as necessary.
Add in the cocoa powder, espresso powder, and salt and process until smooth.
Evenly divide pudding amongst 4 individual cups.
Chill in the refrigerator for at least 1 hour before serving.

916988.title: Homemade Chocolate Milk Pudding

572151.title: Chocolate Pudding
ingredient_list: 1/3 cup plus 1 tablespoon unsweetened cocoa powder
instruction_list: Into a medium bowl, sift together the cocoa, cornstarch, and salt.
Stir in the sugar.
Add the egg yolks to the bowl, and pour in 1/2 cup milk; whisk until well combined.
In a medium saucepan, heat the remaining 2 cups milk and the heavy cream over medium heat until the mixture just comes to a boil.
Slowly whisk the milk mixture into the cocoa mixture.
Rinse out the saucepan but do not dry (to help prevent scorching).
Return the custard mixture to the saucepan, and place over medium-low heat.
Stir in the vanilla.
Stirring constantly with a wooden spoon, cook until the custard has thickened slightly and is the consistency of mayonnaise, about 10 minutes (do not let it boil).
Dont worry if lumps form.
Pour the custard through a fine sieve into a clean bowl, discarding any solids.
Add the chopped chocolate in two batches, stirring until thoroughly melted and combined after each addition.
Divide the pudding among 6 serving dishes, cover with plastic wrap, and chill at least 4 hours or up to overnight before serving.
Garnish with whipped cream and chocolate shavings, if desired.

216006.title: Best Chocolate Pudding (America's Test Kitchens)
ingredient_list: 4 ounces bittersweet chocolate, finely chopped (60% cocoa)
instruction_list: Mix vanilla and espresso powder in a very small bowl.
In a large saucepan, whisk sugar, cocoa, cornstarch and salt until combined.
Whisk in heavy cream, egg yolks and whole milk over medium to medium-high heat.
Bring to a strong SIMMER (should take five minutes) and let simmer for 30 seconds.
Add in butter, one tablespoon at a time, and finely chopped chocolate.
Stir in vanilla/espresso and incorporate.
Strain through a mesh strainer, into individual ramekins or bowls, or into a large bowl.
Cover surface with wax paper or parchment sprayed with Pam to prevent a skin from forming on the top of the pudding.
Chill for at least four hours.
Whisk pudding before serving.

290973.title: Squishy Chocolate Pudding

instruction_list: Mix the flour with 200mls of the sugar, 25mls of the cocoa, salt and spices.
Add melted butter and vanilla essence.
Pour into 25cmx15cmx5cm dish.
Sprinkle over remaining sugar and cocoa.
Pour on boiling water.
Put dish in pan filled with boiling water and bake at 180 for 30-40 minutes.
I used a bit less cocoa in the mix and while it was cooking, pushed some dark chocolate pieces into the pud -- oh man!

838552.title: Chocolate Ricotta Pudding
instruction_list: Melt the chocolate in the top of a double boiler over simmering water (or in the microwave).

Beat at high speed till the mixture is pale yellow and forms soft ribbons.
When the chocolate is melted, add the heavy cream and stir till completely blended.
Pour the chocolate into the egg mixture and mix well.
Add the ricotta and mix again till completely blended.
Divide the mixture among 6 individual serving bowls or goblets.
Refrigerate overnight before serving.
Top with whipped cream if desired.

927846.title: Silken Chocolate Pudding

Add the cinnamon, vanilla, and chile.
Add the cooled chocolate and cooled syrup and blend until smooth.
Pour the pudding into your glassware and chill.
Garnish with a dollop of plain yogurt, bittersweet chocolate shavings, and a sprinkle of ancho chili powder (optional).

Gradually whisk in milk, until batter is smooth.

Cook over medium heat whisking constantly.
Bring to a boil, boil 1 minute.
Remove from heat and stir in bittersweet chocolate and vanilla.
Stir over ice bath to cool.
Fold in white chocolate and pour into coffee cups.

964029.title: Chef Andrew's Berry Cobbler
instruction_list: Preheat oven to 375.
Gently combine (so you don't smash the fruit) all fruit.
filling ingredients and set aside.
Combine baking soda, salt and flour.
Cream together.
butter and sugar until light and fluffy.
Beat in egg.
yolk and vanilla.
Add dry ingredients with a spatula.

Evenly distribute tablespoon sized clumps of cobbler.
across the fruit.

Let cool.
a bit but serve warm.
Great with ice cream.

241934.title: Claret Cobbler
instruction_list: Half-fill a tumbler with crushed ice; add maraschino, sugar, and lemon juice and stir.
Pour in the claret.
Decorate with orange and pineapple garnish.

102391.title: One Cup Cobbler
ingredient_list: 1 cup Sugar, Plus Extra To Sprinkle On Fruit
instruction_list: Preheat oven to 350 degrees.
Peel and cut up peaches.
Sprinkle them with a bit of sugar and set aside.
(I occassionally take a shortcut and use OSages canned peaches, which are wonderful).
Place a stick of butter in a square glass dish or a casserole dish of equivalent size.
Place in the oven and let it melt while the oven is preheating.
Meanwhile, stir by hand the self-rising flour, sugar, and buttermilk.
Stir it well, but it will look slightly lumpy.
Remove the melted butter from the oven.
Place your fruit in the dish.
You should completely cover the bottom of the dish with the fruit.
Next, pour the batter on top of the fruit, making sure to pour it evenly around the dish.
Dont forget the corners!
Bake for about 30-40 minutes, or until the top is a golden brown.
Serve warm with vanilla ice cream!

334407.title: Nectarine Cobbler
ingredient_list: 1/4 cup (1/2 stick) chilled unsalted butter, cut into pieces
1/4 cup chilled solid vegetable shortening, cut into pieces
instruction_list: Position rack in center of oven and preheat to 400F.
Mix all ingredients in 13x9x2-inch glass baking dish.
Bake 15 minutes.
Mix flour, 4 tablespoons sugar, baking powder and salt in large bowl.
Using fingertips, rub in butter and shortening until mixture resembles coarse meal.
Add egg and buttermilk; stir until batter forms.
Remove fruit from oven.
Spoon batter over hot filling in 12 mounds, spacing evenly.
Sprinkle with 2 tablespoons sugar.
Bake until juices thicken and topping is golden, about 30 minutes.
Cool on rack at least 15 minutes.
Serve warm with vanilla ice cream.

829548.title: Delicious Peach Cobbler
ingredient_list: 4 cups fresh peaches, peeled and sliced
instruction_list: Preheat oven to 375.
Melt butter in a 13 x 9" baking dish.
Set aside.
In a medium saucepan, bring the peach slices, 2/3c.
sugar, and lemon juice to a boil over high heat, stirring constantly.
When boiled, stir in the cinnamon and cardamon.
Set aside cooked peach mixture, but reserve 1/4 cup of the peach juice to add to the batter.
Combine flour, 2/3 Celsius sugar, baking powder, and salt in a medium bowl.
Whisk to blend together.
Now, add the milk, vanilla, and the peach juice; stirring to blend the batter together.
Pour batter over melted butter.
Spoon cooked peach mixture over batter.
Bake 375 degrees 40-45 minutes.
Remember ovens vary.
When done, remove from oven.
Sprinkle brown sugar over the top.
Cover with foil.
Allow time for the brown sugar to melt.
This will give you another layer of flavor!
Enjoy!

326148.title: Champagne Cobbler
instruction_list: Muddle the orange and lemon slices with Maraschino liqueur or Cointreau.
Strain into a Champagne flute over ice.
Add cold Champagne and serve with a lemon-peel twist.

254553.title: Apple Cobbler Gobbler
ingredient_list: 2 Honey Maid 40% Less Fat Graham Wafers
1 Tbsp. thawed Cool Whip Light Whipped Topping
instruction_list: Place wafers in microwaveable bowl; top with applesauce.
Microwave on HIGH 15 to 45 sec.
or until heated through.
Let stand 1 min.
to cool slightly.
Top with the whipped topping.

463613.title: Mother Handsome's Pineau Cobbler

instruction_list: In a cocktail shaker, lightly muddle the cantaloupe with the Pineau des Charentes and orange.
Fill the shaker with ice and shake well.
Pour (don't strain) into a chilled white wine glass and serve with a cocktail pick for spearing the cantaloupe chunks.

854066.title: Chicken Sourdough Cobbler
ingredient_list: 1 medium potato (cooked, cubed I use a cold leftover baked potato)
1 cup fat-free chicken broth (can substitute 1 cup white wine)
1 (10 3/4 ounce) 98% fat-free cream of mushroom soup
instruction_list: Toss olive oil cooking spray with garlic powder, sourdough, Parmesan and parsley; set aside.
Saute onions in olive oil cooking spray in a large skillet over medium-high heat 15 minutes or until golden brown.
Add mushrooms and potatoes.
Saute 5 minutes.
Stir in wine and the rest of the ingredients; cook, stirring constantly, 5 minutes or until bubbly.
Spoon mixture into a lightly greased 9-inch square baking dish; top evenly with bread mixture.
Bake at 400 for 15 minutes or until golden brown.
Watch closely that your bread topping does not burn!
Allow to sit for 10-15 minutes before serving.

632328.title: Cobbler Cups
ingredient_list: 12 RhodesTM Dinner Rolls, thawed but still cold
instruction_list: Spoon the pie filling equally into the bottom of each cup of a well sprayed 12 cup muffin tin.
With a pair of scissors, cut one dinner roll into about 20 very small pieces and place on top of the pie filling in one muffin cup.
Repeat with remaining rolls.
Cover with sprayed plastic wrap and let rise 30-45 minutes.
Remove wrap and bake at 350F 15-20 minutes.
Remove from oven and allow to cool to room temperature.
Invert muffin pan and remove cobbler cups.
If some filling remains in the muffin cups, scoop out with a spoon and put it back on the dessert.
Warm the frosting in the microwave and drizzle over the desserts or garnish with whipped cream.

820705.title: Stick A Straw In This Sherry Cobbler Cocktail
instruction_list: In the bottom of a cold Collins glass, muddle 1 lime wedge, 1 lemon wedge, 1 half orange wheel and 3 to 4 total seasonal berries (blackberries, raspberries, strawberries and a cherry, if possible).
Add sherry and simple syrup, then pack glass tightly with crushed ice.
Garnish lavishly with fruits reflective of what was muddled into the bottom of the drink.

414854.title: Dry Vermouth Cobbler
instruction_list: Fill a goblet or highball glass three-quarters full with crushed ice; pour on the vermouth and club soda.
Garnish with lemon peel.

602390.title: Blueberry Cobbler in a Bottle
ingredient_list: 16 ounces blueberry juice (available in the organic section of many grocery stores)
8 ounces absolut red label vodka (100 proof)
instruction_list: Mix together liquid ingredients; stir in apple pie spice.
Pour into a 32 oz bottle, add the cinnamon sticks, and refrigerate for at least a week before serving.
(We often just store it in our cool garage, which works fine.
Blueberry Cobbler is a group drink, often shared straight out of the bottle with folks all sitting around the campfire.
Note: Absolut Red Label has gotten more difficult to find these days.
Try to use higher proof vodka if you can, but if the Red Label is too expensive or unavailable, you can substitute another equal quality high proof vodka.
Potato vodka can also be used, but check the taste before using to make sure it's something you like the taste of and that it's not too sweet for you.
Higher proof is generally drier in taste.

500401.title: Chicken Cobbler
ingredient_list: 2 packages Jiffy Corn Bread Mix (Or Your Favorite Recipe)
instruction_list: Saute onions, celery and carrots in butter until soft.
Add undiluted soups and chicken; mix well.
Pour into a greased 9 x 13 pan.
Mix cornbread mix per package instructions and pour on top of chicken mix.
Bake at 350F for 45 minutes or until the cornbread is golden.
Optional ingredient: whole cranberries.

213831.title: Country Chicken Cobbler (No Hassle Way)
ingredient_list: 1 (16 ounce) bag frozen broccoli carrots cauliflower mix
1.5 (10 3/4 ounce) cans condensed cream of potato soup
2 cups cooked deli chicken (1/2-inch pieces, about 10 ounces)
1 (10 -12 ounce) package refrigerated buttermilk biscuits, each cut into quarters
instruction_list: Preheat oven to 400 degrees F.
In nonstick 12-inch skillet, combine frozen vegetables, undiluted soup, milk, and pepper; cover and cook over medium-high heat until vegetables are thawed, stirring once.
Stir in chicken.
Transfer chicken mixture to shallow 3 1/2- to 4-quart casserole.
Top with biscuit quarters, leaving space between pieces.
Bake 20 to 25 minutes or until biscuits are browned and mixture is heated through.

266795.title: Easy Ww Fruit Cobbler
instruction_list: Preheat oven to 350.
Spray a 9x13 Pan with cooking spray.
Peel, core, and slice apples, lay them in the prepared pan.
Cover evenly with DRY cake mix.
Pour soda evenly over cake mix; DO NOT MIX.
Sprinkle with cinnamon to taste.
Cover with foil, bake for 30 minutes.
Remove foil, bake for an additional 30 minutes.

275295.title: Cookie Fruit Cobbler
ingredient_list: 1 (18 ounce) packagenestle toll house refrigerated chocolate chip cookie dough
1 cup quick oats or 1 cup old fashioned oats
instruction_list: PREHEAT oven to 375F Grease 13 x 9-inch baking pan.
SPOON pie filling into pan.
CRUMBLE cookie dough into medium bowl.
Add oats; mix well.
Sprinkle over filling.
BAKE for 24 to 28 minutes or until top is deep golden brown.
Serve warm or at room temperature.

898639.title: Billy Sunday Summer Cobbler Cocktail
ingredient_list: 3/4 ounce High West Western Oat white whiskey
instruction_list: Build all components in a cocktail shaker and shake fast and hard for 3 seconds.
Single strain into fluted glass and fill with crushed ice.
Top with wild strawberries.

88170.title: Super Easy Cobbler
instruction_list: first heat up oven to 350 degrees Fahrenheit.
Place two cans of filling in the 9 x 11 baking pan.
Next lay an entire box of vanilla cake mix on top of fruit layer.
Next slice the cube of butter supper thin and spread it out over the last layer evenly.
Place in oven and let bake for 30 minutes.
Pull out to cool, can be severed as is or with whip cream, ice-cream or what ever you want.

799697.title: Brandy Cobbler
instruction_list: Fill a tumbler three-quarters full with crushed ice.
Add brandy, curacao, and sugar.
Stir.
Decorate with the orange slice and pineapple stick.

573558.title: Delicious Cobbler Recipe
ingredient_list: 1 can fruit, or possibly may use fresh
instruction_list: Preheat oven to 350 degrees.
Heat butter and pour into 9 x 13 inch casserole dish.
In separate bowl mix sugar, flour, and lowfat milk with wire whisk.
Pour over butter but Don't STIR.
Pour fruit over sugar/flour mix but Don't STIR.
Bake approximately 45 min to one hour, till golden.
For added flavor and appearance, sprinkle sugar over entire cobbler about 20 min into baking time.

17791.title: Berry Cobbler
instruction_list: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
Grease a 9x9 inch baking dish.
In a large bowl combine flour, sugar, baking powder and salt.
Stir in butter, milk, vanilla and egg until smooth.
Fold in raspberries.
Pour into prepared pan.
Bake in preheated oven 35 to 40 minutes, until top is firm.

370784.title: Cheater's Cobbler
ingredient_list: 2 tablespoons margarine or 2 tablespoons butter, melted
instruction_list: Heat oven to 400.
Spoon pie filling into 8-inch square pan.
Stir together biscuit mix, milk, sugar, and margarine with fork until blended.
Drop by spoonsful on top of filling.
Bake 20-25 minutes, until golden brown.
Serve warm.

22392.title: Cajun Fig Cobbler
instruction_list: Place butter in a 2 quart baking dish.
Bake at 375* until butter melts.
Remove from oven, and set aside.
Combine flour, sugar, and baking powder in a large bowl.
Add milk, egg, and vanilla, stirring until smooth.
Pour batter into baking dish; spoon preserves over batter.
Bake at 375* for 40 min., covering dish with aluminum foil after 20 minute Serve warm with vanilla ice cream or whipped cream.

624121.title: Oregon Marion Berry Cobbler
instruction_list: Preheat oven to 350F/180C/4.
Topping: Mix butter + sugar until fluffy.
Add in other ingredients.
Filling: mix berries with other filling ingredients.
Pour into baking dish + spoon butter dots over berry mixture.
Spoon dollops of topping over berry mix.
Bake for 40 minutes or until golden.

265626.title: Lazy Cobbler
instruction_list: Pour contents of fruit filling into a casserole dish.
Spread dry cake mix evenly over fruit.
Cut butter into equal slices over top.
Cover with foil & bake at 350* for 45 minutes.

1014032.title: Port Cobbler
instruction_list: Fill two-thirds of a tumbler with crushed ice, add orange juice and curacao, and stir.
Pour in the port and decorate with orange slice and pineapple stick.

1017841.title: Super Duper Easy Yummy Cobbler
ingredient_list: 3 (15 1/4 ounce) cans canned fruit (Peahes in light syrup are what I normally do, but I've also switched it to apple, blueberry, cherry,)
instruction_list: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees.
Pour the fruit in to a large baking pan, glass pans work best but I have also used the aluminum "to-go" pans when taking them to potlucks and such and it works fine.
Cut the lemon in half and squeeze it over the fruit.
Melt the butter in a large microwave safe bowl.
Add the cake mix and egg.
Mix with a fork as best you can.
There will still be tiny lumps and stuff and it will be a little slimy looking, but that's ok.
Spread the cake mix as evenly as you can.
It won't spread out all over it but it should cover the majority of it.
Sprinkle the cinnamon and sugar on top.
Place it in the oven on the middle rack.
Baking time varies so you kind of have to keep and eye on it.
It will probably be about an hour to and hour and a half.
The top will be golden brown and if you test it with a toothpick it should come out clean.
Let cool for 30 minutes and serve.
It's best warm with a big scoop of vanilla ice cream.

249057.title: Mamma K's Fig Preserve Cobbler
instruction_list: Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).
Place butter in a baking dish; melt butter in the preheated oven, about 5 minutes.
Mix flour, sugar, and baking powder together in a bowl; add milk, egg, and vanilla extract.
Stir until smooth; pour into the melted butter.
Spoon fig preserves evenly over the batter.
Bake in the preheated oven for 20 minutes.
