ingredient_list: 1 large ripe haas avocado, halved, peeled, pitted, and cut into 1/2-inch dice
1 large sweet grapefruit, peeled, and sliced into 1/2-inch rounds, then quartered into 1-inch pieces
instruction_list: Combine the lettuce, tarragon, parsley, mint, basil, and scallions in a large mixing bowl.
Gently toss with the olive oil, lemon juice, and salt to taste.
Fold in the diced avocado and grapefruit gently so as not to break up the avocado.
Divide the salad evenly among salad bowls and finish with a generous grind of pepper.

126886.title: Peggy's Delicious Broccoli Salad
ingredient_list: 2 cups broccoli, cut into small pieces
instruction_list: Mix together the broccoli, green grapes (halved), chopped green onions, slivered almonds, and golden raisins.
Fry the bacon crisp and crumble over the salad.
Mix the mayo, sugar, and vinegar to make the dressing.
Pour dressing over salad and stir.
Let set in fridge for 2 hours before serving.

490805.title: Best Broccoli Salad
ingredient_list: 1 bunch broccoli (tops only, broken into small pieces)
1 lb bacon, fried crisp and crumbled
instruction_list: Combine all the salad ingredients, tossing well to mix.
Mix the dressing ingredients together then toss with the salad mix.
Let stand at least 1 hour in the refrigerator (can be made the day before).

404929.title: Broccoli Salad
ingredient_list: 1 cup Cole Slaw Dressing (store Bought Or Homemade)
Optional Add-ins: Chopped Cooked Bacon, Almond Slices
instruction_list: Mix everything together in a large bowl, cover and chill overnight.
Serve!
For a little variety, you can add bacon bits or use almond slices instead of the sunflower kernels.

747326.title: Crunchy Broccoli Salad
ingredient_list: 1 bunch broccoli, cut into bite size pieces
cauliflower, cut into bite size pieces (equal to amount of broccoli used)
instruction_list: Prepare and chop all salad ingredients and place in bowl.
In a separate bowl, make dressing.
Mix well.
Stir into salad.
Best if refridgerated for 1-2 hours before serving.

401420.title: Coconut Flank Steak & Broccoli Salad with Peanuts and Basil
ingredient_list: 2 Tablespoons Peanut Or Vegetable Oil Plus Extra For Your Skillet
Sriracha Hot Sauce And Lime Wedges, Optional For Garnish
instruction_list: In a large sealable container (or zip bag), add the coconut milk, brown sugar, fish sauce, soy sauce, lime juice and oil.
Stir to combine and tuck the flank steak into the mixture.
Seal the bag, smash it around a little to coat the steak, put it into the refrigerator and marinate 3 hours, up to overnight.
Place a large cast iron skillet or grill-pan over high heat with a bit of neutral oil (veg or peanut) in it.
Remove the flank steak from the marinade (reserve the marinadeyoull use it in a bit), shaking to remove excess marinade, and place it on the pan for 4-5 minutes on each side for medium-rare.
I dont recommend cooking past medium-rare as flank tends to get tough if over-cooked.
Remove it from the skillet and wrap in tin foil to rest.
Pour leftover marinade and peanuts into a saucepan and bring to a boil.
Then turn heat down to a simmer and add the broccoli and toss around a bit.
Cover and cook just until bright green but still crunchy in the center, around 2 minutes.
Remove the broccoli and peanuts from the pan using a slotted spoon and set aside.
Let the coconut marinade continue to simmer until reduced and deep brown.
It should coat the back of a spoon when ready.
Slice flank into very thin slices, cutting against the grain, and at a slight diagonal so that the slices are wide.
Toss the meat with the broccoli and thickened coconut and peanut mixture.
Taste for seasoning and add salt if needed.
Spoon onto a platter or serving dishes and top with basil leaves and extra lime wedges.
I serve with lots of spicy Sriracha as it tends to go well with these flavours.
To stretch the dish out and provide something a bit more filling, serve with rice or rice noodles.
Recipe adapted from Donna Hay Magazine.

426211.title: Broccoli and Chicken Salad
ingredient_list: 1 lb. boneless skinless chicken breasts, cut into thin strips
1-1/2 cups halved seedless red grapes Target 1 lb For $2.99 thru 02/06
instruction_list: Cook and stir chicken in large nonstick skillet on medium heat 4 to 5 min.
or until done.
Combine remaining ingredients in large bowl.
Add chicken; mix lightly.
Refrigerate 30 min.

26618.title: Asian Beef and Broccoli Salad
ingredient_list: - beef flank steak Safeway 1 lb For $5.99 thru 02/09
1-1/4 gal. capellini, cooked, rinsed and drained
6-1/4 cups carrots, cut into julienne strips
instruction_list: Saute garlic in hot oil 1 to 2 minutes or until golden brown; set aside.
Grill steak 5 to 6 minutes on each side or until medium doneness; cool.
Cut into 1/4-inch-wide strips.
Toss garlic and steak with remaining ingredients; cover.
Refrigerate several hours or until well chilled.

287997.title: Susans Broccoli Slaw Salad
ingredient_list: 2 packages (3 Oz. Package) Chicken Ramen Noodle, Noodles And Soup Seasoning Packets Separated
instruction_list: Prepare dressing by combining oil, vinegar, and the chicken ramen noodle seasoning packets.
Refrigerate overnight (I usually dont allow myself enough time to do this and its still delicious).
Break up noodles and mix all remaining slaw ingredients together.
Pour dressing over the slaw ingredients and toss.
Chill before serving.

285957.title: Broccoli Slaw Salad
instruction_list: Combine all ingredients except dressing in large bowl.
Drizzle with dressing; mix lightly.

707891.title: Colorful Broccoli Salad
ingredient_list: 1 whole Lemon Zest And Its Juice
2 Tablespoons Bragg Organic Sea Kelp Delight Seasoning
instruction_list: Combine all ingredients until evenly distributed and store covered in the refrigerator.
Its that easy!

656749.title: Chicken, Cheddar & Broccoli Pasta Salad
ingredient_list: 2 cans (5 oz. each) chunk white chicken breast, drained, flaked
1/2 cup MIRACLE WHIP Dressing Family Dollar $3.50 thru 02/07
instruction_list: Cook pasta in large saucepan as directed on package, omitting salt and adding broccoli to the boiling water for the last 4 min.
; drain.
Place in large bowl.
Add remaining ingredients; mix lightly.

93614.title: Buckwheat and Broccoli Salad in Tangy Miso Dressing
instruction_list: In a small, heavy saucepan, heat the buckwheat groats over medium-high heat.
Swirl the groats in the pan, toasting them until they are crackling, hot to the touch, and fragrant, about 5 minutes.
In a wire-mesh strainer, wash the hot buckwheat quickly and drain thoroughly.
Put the 1 1/2 cups water in the pan and bring to a boil.
Add the buckwheat, return to a boil, cover tightly, and reduce the heat to the lowest setting.
Cook for about 20 minutes, until all the liquid is absorbed.
Take the pan off the heat and let stand for 5 minutes, then transfer the cooked grain to a bowl, cover, and let cool to room temperature.
In a large measuring cup, whisk the miso, canola oil, and vinegar until smooth.
Whisk in the sesame oil, ginger, garlic, pepper flakes, and honey.
Pour the dressing over the cooled buckwheat and toss to coat.
To serve, spread the buckwheat on a platter, and top with the broccoli, carrot, and scallions.
Sprinkle the cashews over the salad and serve.
Alternatively, mix the veggies into the grain and chill.

312444.title: Orzo and Broccoli Salad
ingredient_list: 1 cup Kraft Extra Virgin Olive Oil Tuscan Italian Dressing, divided
1 cup Cracker Barrel Crumbled Feta Cheese with Oregano, Sun Dried Tomatoes and Black Pepper
instruction_list: Cook pasta in large saucepan as directed on package, adding broccoli to the boiling water for the last 2 min.
; drain.
Rinse with cold water; drain well.
Place pasta mixture in large bowl.
Add tomatoes, peppers and 3/4 cup dressing; mix lightly.
Refrigerate 1 hour.
Add cheese, nuts and remaining dressing; mix lightly.

447498.title: Charred Tomato and Broccoli with Chicken Salad
ingredient_list: 1 1/2 pounds chicken breasts boneless, skinless and trimmed, or 3 cups shredded cooked chicken breast (skip Step 1)
2 teaspoons olive oil, extra-virgin plus 3 tablespoons, divided
instruction_list: Put chicken in a skillet or saucepan and add enough water to cover, bring to a simmer over high heat.
Cover, reduce heat and simmer gently until the chicken is cooked through and no longer pink in the middle, 10 to 12 minutes.
Transfer to a cutting board.
When cool enough to handle, shred with two forks into bite-size pieces.
Bring a large pot of water to a boil, add broccoli and cook until tender, 3 to 5 minutes.
Drain and rinse with cold water until cool.
Meanwhile, core tomatoes and cut in half crosswise.
Gently squeeze out seeds and discard.
Set the tomatoes cut-side down on paper towels to drain for about 5 minutes.
Place a large heavy skillet, such as cast-iron, over high heat until very hot.
Brush the cut sides of the tomatoes with 1 teaspoon oil and place cut-side down in the pan.
Cook until charred and beginning to soften, 4 to 5 minutes.
Brush the tops lightly with another 1 teaspoon oil, turn and cook until the skin is charred, 1 to 2 minutes more.
Transfer to a plate to cool.
Do not clean the pan.
Heat the remaining 3 tablespoons oil in the pan over medium heat.
Stir in salt, pepper and chili powder and cook, stirring constantly, until fragrant, about 45 seconds.
Slowly pour in lemon juice (it may splatter), then remove the pan from the heat.
Stir to scrape up any browned bits.
Coarsely chop the tomatoes and combine them in a large bowl with the shredded chicken, broccoli and the pan dressing; toss to coat.

754546.title: Broccoli Pasta Salad
ingredient_list: 2 small red bell peppers, seeded and diced
34 cup of your favorite vinaigrette dressing
instruction_list: Thaw peas by running under cold water and drained.
Cook broccoli florets according to package directions, refrigerate.
Cook pasta according to package directions, refrigerate.
Place 1 cup water in 4 quart saucepan, bring to boil and cook carrots 2 to 3 minutes until tender-crisp, drain and chill.
Combine peppers, peas, lemon zest and remaining ingredients in large bowl, mix together.
Add chilled broccoli, pasta and carrots.
Toss gently and chill well before serving.

180656.title: Broccoli and Almond Salad
ingredient_list: 2 Tbsp. shredded carrots Target 2 lb For $3.00 thru 02/06
instruction_list: Place all ingredients except dressing on serving plate.
Drizzle with dressing just before serving.

839515.title: Broccoli And Chicken Salad With Lemon Dressing Recipe
ingredient_list: 1 lb Red-skinned potatoes, unpeeled, cut into 1/2-inch cubes
2 Tbsp. Extra virgin olive oil, (preferably extra-virgin)
1 Tbsp. Minced fresh thyme or possibly 1 tsp. dry
instruction_list: Add in water to large Dutch oven to depth of 1 inch and bring to boil.
Spread potatoes and carrot proportionately on steamer rack.
Place steamer rack in Dutch oven.
Cover and steam vegetables till almost tender, about 9 min.
Add in broccoli florets to steamer rack; cover and steam till all vegetables are just tender, about 3 min.
Transfer vegetables to large bowl and cold to room temperature.
Add in chicken and red onion to bowl of vegetables.
Combine oil and garlic in small saucepan.
Cook over low heat just till garlic begins to sizzle, about 1 minute.
Remove from heat and cold slightly.
Whisk in lemon juice and thyme.
Pour hot dressing over salad and toss to coat.
Season salad to taste with salt and pepper.
Serves 4.

201599.title: Broccoli Waldorf Salad
instruction_list: In a larg serving bowl,add the first four ingredients.
Drizzle with dressing; toss to coat.

397260.title: Broccoli Astroturf Salad
ingredient_list: 4 cups fresh broccoli florets, chopped bite-size
1 cup raisins or 1 cup dried cranberries
instruction_list: Combine mayo/yogurt, sugar, & vinegar in a large bowl, and stir in the remaining ingredients.
Refrigerate 2 hours or up to overnight before serving.
Taste before serving.
Depending on the saltiness of the bacon, it may need a bit of salt.

100668.title: Broccoli Salad
ingredient_list: 3 cups red grapes, sliced in half
instruction_list: Toss all ingredients.
Mix dressing ingredients and pour on top of salad.
Mix well.
Serve.
Enjoy!

550181.title: Crunchy Broccoli Salad
instruction_list: Chop broccoli into 1/2-3/4" pieces.
Finely dice Celery & Red Onion.
Shred Carrot.
Combine all dry ingredients in bowl.
Whisk Yogurt/OJ/Mayo in small bowl pour over dry mixture, toss to coat.

568325.title: Broccoli Salad
instruction_list: Chop broccoli florets into bite-sized pieces and place into a large bowl.
Fry the bacon until crisp and then break into bite-sized pieces; add to the broccoli.
Add the cranberries, pine nuts, and diced red onions to the broccoli and bacon.
Using a whisk, combine the mayonnaise, sugar, and the red wine vinegar until well blended.
Pour the dressing over the salad and toss.
Chill 3 to 4 hours and serve.

482360.title: Rose Cove Broccoli Salad
ingredient_list: 1 12 teaspoons stonewall kitchen habanero mango hot sauce
instruction_list: Blanch the broccoli florets, drain, and set aside.
To make the aioli, blend 1c mayonaise, 1.5 tsp stonewall kitchen habanero mango hot sauce, 1 tps stonewall kitchen country ketchup, and 1/2 tps minced garlic.
Combine the broccoli, onion, pistachios, feta cheese and aioli.
Chill for 1 or more hours.
Serve.

315074.title: Broccoli Salad Made Easy
ingredient_list: 1 package maple flavored bacon, cooked crisp and crumbled
instruction_list: In large bowl combine broccoli, grapes, bacon, and sunflower seeds, set aside.
In small bowl combine mayonnaise, sugar, and vinegar.
Stir in enough milk to make dressing of desired consistency.
Toss dressing with broccoli mixture, and cover and refrigerate at least 1 hour.

941608.title: Broccoli And Tempeh Salad Recipe
ingredient_list: 1/2 c. red onion, minced salt and pepper to taste
instruction_list: In a steamer basket set over boiling water, steam the tempeh and broccoli till desired tenderness or possibly leave raw, if preferred.
(Steam broccoli if package directions require steaming).
In a mixing bowl, thoroughly whisk the mayonnaise, honey, and vinegar.
Add in tempeh, broccoli, soynuts, and red onion and combine well.
Season with salt and pepper if you like.
Chill for one hour or possibly overnight..
Makes 6 servings
Serving size: 1 c.

600553.title: Tangy Broccoli Salad
ingredient_list: 1 medium bunch broccoli, cut into flowerets (about 6 cups)
1/4 cup OSCAR MAYER Real Bacon Recipe Pieces or Bits
instruction_list: Mix dressing, sugar and vinegar in large bowl.
Add remaining ingredients; mix lightly.
Refrigerate.

684063.title: Broccoli Salad
ingredient_list: 1 -2 head fresh broccoli (do not use frozen!)
instruction_list: Cook bacon (I make it easy and buy the already cooked bacon in the refrigerator section) and crumble into pieces.
Chop up top of broccoli into bite size pieces.
Mix broccoli, onions, bacon and mozzarella in large bowl.
In separate bowl combine vinegar, sugar and mayo.
Pour over broccoli mixture and toss to coat.
Best if made a day ahead.

327796.title: Broccoli Salad Recipe
ingredient_list: 3 tablespoons freshly squeezed lemon juice (from about 1 medium lemon)
2 tablespoons freshly squeezed orange juice (from about 1/2 medium orange)
1/2 teaspoon kosher salt, plus more to taste
1/4 cup thinly sliced scallions, green parts only
6 strips bacon, cooked until crisp, chopped
1/2 ounce Parmesan cheese, shaved, plus more for garnishing
instruction_list: Whisk all the dressing ingredients together in a medium bowl.
Set aside.
Peel the broccoli stems and cut the stalks into 2-inch chunks.
Slice each chunk, then cut lengthwise into thick matchsticks.
Separate the broccoli heads into bite-size florets.
Combine stalks and florets in a medium salad bowl.
Add the scallions, cranberries, bacon, and sunflower seeds to the bowl.
Add half the dressing, toss to combine, and taste.
Add more dressing and additional salt to taste.
Finish by tossing in the shaved Parmesan.
Serve scattered with additional Parmesan shavings.

973963.title: Chinese-Style Broccoli Salad
instruction_list: Separate broccoli into bite-sized florets.
Peel tough skin off stem and quarter it into 2 inch pieces cut slantwise.
Bring 2 1/2 quarts water, 2 tablespoons oil and 1 tablespoon salt to boil.
Add broccoli and boil quickly for 1 minute; plunge into cold water to set color; drain and place on platter or in a bowl.
In a small bowl combine soy sauce, vinegar, sesame oil, 1/4 teaspoon salt and sugar.
Pour mixture over broccoli, toss.
This salad can be served hot or cold, your choice!

140947.title: Broccoli Salad (Low Cal) Recipe
instruction_list: Wash and cut broccoli in pcs.
Cook bacon till crisp.
Add in sunflower seeds, grapes, onion and bacon.
Toss.
Before serving mix mayonnaise, Equal and vinegar.
Chill.
Mix with salad to serve.
Delicious.

79446.title: Caesar Salad
ingredient_list: 9 cups romaine lettuce, in bite size pieces
12 cup garlic-flavored croutons or 12 cup caesar-flavor croutons
4 slices turkey bacon, cooked til crisp and crumbled
6 slices red onions, broken into rings
instruction_list: In a large bowl combine lettuce, crumbled bacon, onion and croutons.
Pour the dressing over and 1/2 the cheese, toss well.
Sprinkle with remaining cheese and serve.

994313.title: KRAFT Classic Caesar Salad
ingredient_list: 1/2 cup Kraft 100% Parmesan Light Grated Cheese
1/2 cup Kraft Calorie-Wise Creamy Caesar Dressing
instruction_list: Toss lettuce with croutons and cheese in large bowl.
Add dressing; mix lightly.

402373.title: Dom's Caesar Salad
instruction_list: Wash lettuce and tear into large pieces.
Rub garlic halves around the inside of a large wooden salad bowl, and discard garlic.
In bowl, combine lemon juice, oil, mustard and pepper.
Add egg yolk and mix well.
Add lettuce, croutons and Parmesan, and toss lightly.
Top with additional Parmesan if desired.

493357.title: Emeril's Eggless Caesar Salad
ingredient_list: 1 head romaine lettuce, washed and dried, torn into bite-size pieces (about 10 cups)
instruction_list: In a mixing bowl combine the lemon juice, garlic, mustard, anchovy paste, salt, and pepper.
Whisk in the canola oil to blend.
In a large salad bowl, toss the lettuce with the dressing.
Add the croutons and top with Parmesan.

203266.title: Safe Caesar Salad
ingredient_list: Salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste
2 tablespoons commercial mayonnaise or liquid egg product (see note) (optional)
6 flat anchovies, drained and cut in small pieces (optional)
1/2 cup freshly grated imported Italian Parmesan cheese
instruction_list: Early in the day, mix garlic and oil together and set aside, covered, at room temperature.
Garlic and oil should be allowed to marinate at least 8 hours and can be left to marinate up to 4 days.
Preheat oven (or toaster oven) to 300 degrees.
Remove crusts from bread and cut bread into 3/4-inch cubes.

Remove garlic from oil, toss bread cubes with 4 tablespoons of the oil, spread them on a baking sheet and allow them to toast about 20 minutes until they are golden brown, turning them so that they toast evenly.
Remove from oven and allow to cool briefly.
Remove heavy outer leaves and cores of the heads of lettuce.
Tear remaining leaves in 2-inch pieces.
Place them in a salad bowl and season to taste with salt and pepper.
Toss with the remaining garlic-flavored oil.
Mix Worcestershire sauce with lemon juice and, if using, the mayonnaise or egg substitute.
Pour over the lettuce, and toss.
Add croutons and, if using, the anchovies.
Toss again.
Sprinkle with grated cheese and serve.

900734.title: The Great Caesar Salad
instruction_list: In a food processor combine the egg yolk, garlic, mustard, lemon juice, vinegar, and Worcestershire.
Pulse the mixture together until garlic is finely chopped.
Then, while continuing to pulse, add the olive oil in a very patient, slow, steady stream to produce a smooth, creamy mayonnaise like emulsion.
Add the anchovy, pulse for 30 seconds, and season with salt and pepper to taste.
(Can be stored covered in the refrigerator for up to 4 days).
Place lettuce into 6 individual salad bowls (if wooden, smear with additional clove of garlic).
Pour desired amount of dressing over top of each salad.
Sprinkle with croutons, Parmesan cheese, and optional bacon bits.

715578.title: Beer Battered Fish with Caesar Style Salad
ingredient_list: 500 g packet frozen I&J Crispy Battered Fish Fillets in Beer Batter
1 cup finely shredded carrot Target 2 lb For $3.00 thru 02/06
instruction_list: COOK frozen I&J Crispy Battered Fish Fillets in Beer Batter following packet directions.
COMBINE shredded red and green cabbage, carrot, celery and spring onions.
Add KRAFT Caesar Dressing and gently toss.
SERVE cooked fish with salad and cooked chips on the side.
RECIPE TIP: As an alternative to cabbage try shredded crisp iceberg lettuce.

111438.title: FAJITA CHICKEN CAESAR SALAD Recipe
instruction_list: PLACE ALL INGREDIENTS IN A BOWL.
MIX WELL TO INCORPORATE DRESSING

274879.title: Chicken Caesar Tortellini Salad
instruction_list: Bake or boil chicken breasts.
Season to taste and cube.
Cook tortellini according to package directions.
Chop all vegetables.
After pasta and chicken has cooled, add to vegetables.
Add Feta cheese and dressing to your preference.
Gently mix.
Chill.
And enjoy!

675714.title: Creamy Caesar Potato Salad
ingredient_list: 2 lb. (900 g) red potatoes, cut into 3/4-inch chunks King Sooper's 5 lb For $1.88 thru 02/09
1/2 cup Kraft 100% Parmesan Aged Grated Cheese
instruction_list: Cook potatoes in pan of boiling water 10 to 12 min.
or just until tender; drain.
Place potatoes in large bowl.
Add dressing; toss to evenly coat potatoes.
Add remaining ingredients; mix lightly.
Serve warm.

920114.title: Caesar Salad Rolls
instruction_list: Add rice paper, 1 sheet at a time, to large bowl of warm water; let stand 15 to 20 sec.
or until softened.
Drain on clean kitchen towel; transfer to work surface.
Place 1 prosciutto slice on centre of each rice paper sheet; top with remaining ingredients.
Carefully fold bottom of paper over filling, then fold in both sides and roll up tightly, starting at bottom edge.
Cut in half to serve.

121859.title: Marinated Caesar Style Potato Salad Recipe
ingredient_list: 1/4 c. minced fresh parsley or possibly 1 1/2 teaspoon parsley flakes
2 Large eggs, hard-boiled, cut into wedges
instruction_list: In small jar with tight lid, combine all dressing ingredients and shake well.
In large bowl, combine all salad ingredients except Large eggs.
Pour dressing over potato mix.
Toss lightly.
Chill to blend flavors.
Garnish with egg wedges.
8 (1/2 c.) servings.
Calories: 190 per serving.

959113.title: Mexican Style Caesar Salad
ingredient_list: 270 g complete caesar salad in a bag (Woolworths Fresh Caesar salad )
420 g red kidney beans, drained, rinsed
instruction_list: Preheat oven to 180C Divide the tortillas between two baking trays.
Bake for 5 minutes, or until crisp.
Cut the tortillas into wedges.
Place the eggs in a saucepan and cover with cold water.
Bring to the boil, stirring occasionally to centre the yolks, boil for 7 minutes.
Drain and plunge into cold water.
Peel eggs and cut into quarters.
Combine the salad (including bacon and croutons from the salad mix), red kidney beans and avocado with the eggs and tortilla.
Whisk the Caesar salad dressing with the taco seasoning and sour cream.
Drizzle the dressing over salad, and serve immediately.

67693.title: Creamy Grilled Shrimp Caesar Salad
ingredient_list: 3/4 cup Kraft Caesar with Bacon Dressing, divided
1 lb. cleaned large shrimp Safeway 1 lb For $8.99 thru 02/09
instruction_list: Pour 1/4 cup of the dressing over shrimp in shallow glass dish; stir gently to evenly coat shrimp.
Cover; refrigerate 30 min.
to marinate.
Meanwhile, soak 4 wooden skewers in water.
Preheat barbecue to medium heat.
Remove shrimp from marinade; discard marinade.
Thread shrimp onto skewers.
GRILL 5 min.
or until shrimp turn pink.
Toss salad with the remaining 1/2 cup dressing; divide evenly among 4 salad plates.
Top with the shrimp; sprinkle with croutons.

670515.title: Kale-Chicken Caesar Salad for Two
ingredient_list: 3 cups loosely packed chopped stemmed kale
1 cup shredded rotisserie chicken Safeway 1 lb For $1.99 thru 02/09
1 slice OSCAR MAYER Bacon, cooked, crumbled
instruction_list: Toss kale with dressing in large bowl.
Let stand 10 min.
Add remaining ingredients; mix lightly.

460883.title: Caesar Tortellini Salad
ingredient_list: 1 (10 ounce) package complete caesar salad in a bag
instruction_list: Cook tortellini to desired doneness as directed on package.
Rinse with cold water; drain.
Meanwhile, place salad greens from Caesar salad mix in large bowl.
Add dressing from packet; toss to coat.
Add cooked tortellini; toss to combine.
Sprinkle with croutons and cheese from packets.
Serve immediately.

981496.title: Caesar Tortellini Salad
ingredient_list: 1-1/2 qt. Kraft Calorie-Wise Zesty Italian Dressing, divided
6 Tbsp. lemon juice Safeway 4 ct For $5.00 thru 02/09
beef flank steaks Safeway 1 lb For $5.99 thru 02/09
portobello mushrooms, gills and stems removed
instruction_list: Cook tortellini as directed on package; drain.
Place in large bowl.
Beat dressing, lemon juice and cheese with whisk until blended.
Pour half the dressing mixture over combined steak and mushrooms in separate large bowl; toss to coat.
Remove steak and mushrooms from dressing mixture; discard dressing mixture.
Grill steak and mushrooms on medium-high heat 4 min.
on each side or until steak is medium-rare, or desired doneness, and mushrooms are lightly charred and tender.
Transfer to cutting board; let stand 5 min.
Cut into diagonal slices.
Add to tortellini; mix lightly.
Add lettuce and remaining dressing mixture; toss to coat.

108816.title: Caesar Salad Dressing Recipe
instruction_list: MIX the above ingredients together.
COVER and chill for several hrs allowing flavors to mingle.

962599.title: Easy Chicken Caesar Pasta Salad
ingredient_list: 1 pkg. (11.15 oz.) KRAFT Caesar Pasta Salad
1 pkg. (6 oz.) OSCAR MAYER CARVING BOARD Flame Grilled Chicken Breast Strips
1 cup chopped tomato King Sooper's 1 lb For $0.99 thru 02/09
instruction_list: Prepare Pasta Salad as directed on package.
Add remaining ingredients; mix lightly.
Cover.
Refrigerate at least 1 hour before serving.
Store leftover salad in refrigerator.

53694.title: Classic Caesar Salad
ingredient_list: 1 Tbsp. fresh lemon juice Safeway 4 ct For $5.00 thru 02/09
1/2 cup DI GIORNO Shredded Parmesan Cheese
instruction_list: Beat oil, garlic, juice, Worcestershire sauce and pepper in medium bowl with wire whisk until well blended.
Stir in anchovies.
Pour over lettuce in large salad bowl; toss to coat.
Add croutons and cheese; mix lightly.

1003841.title: Best Ever Caesar Salad Dressing!!!!
instruction_list: Combine all ingredients into blender on high, then low to mix well.
Pour over romaine and add croutons and bacon bits.

263198.title: Caesar Salad
ingredient_list: 8 cups loosely packed torn romaine lettuce
1/2 cup KRAFT Reduced Fat Parmesan Style Grated Topping
1/2 cup KRAFT Lite Creamy Caesar Dressing
instruction_list: Toss lettuce with croutons and grated topping in large bowl.
Add dressing; mix lightly.

952589.title: Caesar Salad
ingredient_list: 1 cup cubed homemade-style white or Italian bread (1/2-inch croutons)
1 medium head romaine lettuce, leaves separated, washed, dried and chilled
instruction_list: Dry out bread cubes in a low oven (325 degreesF) for 20 minutes; they should be dry but not browned.
Meanwhile, mash garlic with 1/4 teaspoon salt in 2 tablespoons oil and set aside for 20 minutes.
Strain oil through a sieve into a saute pan and heat over low heat.
Add croutons, toss to coat and saute until they are lightly colored.
In a large salad bowl toss romaine leaves with remaining tablespoon olive oil, until well-coated.
Add lemon juice and Worcestershire sauce, break egg over salad, sprinkle with Parmesan cheese, and season with salt and pepper to taste.
Toss salad, scooping leaves from the bottom and turning gently, taking care not to break them.
Add croutons and serve immediately on chilled plates.

387671.title: Caesar Salad (Warner)
instruction_list: With the motor running, drop garlic cloves into the bowl of a food processor fitted with the steel blade.
Mince, then add anchovies and process to combine.
With the motor running, add oil in a thin stream until thickened.
Add lemon juice and egg; process a few seconds to combine.
Tear lettuce leaves into manageable pieces and place in a large salad bowl.
Add dressing and toss.
Sprinkle with Parmesan cheese, toss again, and top with croutons.
Serve at once, passing the pepper mill for each person to add to taste.

16726.title: Southwest Caesar Salad
ingredient_list: 1 head romaine lettuce, washed, shredded (about 6 cups)
1 cup frozen whole kernel corn, thawed
1/2 of a red bell pepper, cut into thin strips
instruction_list: Place mayo, lime juice, onions, ground red pepper and salt in food processor or blender container; cover.
Process until well blended.
Gradually add oil through feed tube at top, processing until well blended after each addition.
Toss lettuce with the croutons, corn, bell peppers, cilantro and cheese in large bowl.
Add mayo mixture; toss to evenly coat.
Serve immediately.

509921.title: Caesar Salad
ingredient_list: 1 tablespoon sherry or red wine vinegar
1 to 2 tablespoons minced anchovies, or to taste
2 eggs or 1/2 cup pasteurized egg product
Salt and black pepper to taste
1/2 to 1 cup freshly grated Parmesan cheese
2 tablespoons fresh lemon juice, or to taste
instruction_list: Peel away all of the dark green (and even medium dark green) outer leaves of the romaine heads; you want only hearts and tender inner leaves.
Rub the inside of your salad bowl with the garlic clove; discard it.
Add the oil, vinegar, and anchovies to the bowl and whisk to combine.
Whisk in the eggs, salt and pepper, and 1/2 cup of the Parmesan.

Taste the dressing on a leaf of romaine at this point and assess how much more acidity it needs and whether or not it will need any additional salt (remembering that youre going to add more salty Parmesan in a minute) or pepper.
Add lemon juice to taste and salt and pepper as necessary.
Toss the lettuce in the dressing; top with the croutons and remaining Parmesan, then bring to the table and toss again.
Serve immediately.

235229.title: My World Famous Caesar Salad
ingredient_list: 2 cups toasted croutons (I use sourdough buns, cubed - yum!)
1 tablespoon fresh lemon juice (though the bottled kind will do in a pinch!)
1 lb washed chopped romaine lettuce or 1 lb romaine lettuce hearts, separated into leaves
instruction_list: Mince two of the garlic cloves; sprinkle with salt and mash into a paste with a mortar and pestle.
Stir 4 tablespoons of the olive oil into the paste.
Heat 1 tablespoon of the olive oil over medium-low heat; add garlic paste/olive oil mixture.
Gently heat the paste mixture.
Add the croutons and toss to coat, simply warming the croutons.
Remove croutons from pan and set aside.
Mince remaining garlic and combine in a small bowl with lemon juice and Worcestershire sauce.
Whisk in remaining 1/2 cup of olive oil in a slow, steady stream to emulsify.
Season to taste with salt and freshly ground black pepper.
In a large bowl, toss chopped romaine and croutons with dressing, and sprinkle with Parmigiano-Reggiano.
If using romaine hearts, arrange on plate, drizzle with dressing, top with croutons, and sprinkle with Parmigiano-Reggiano.

203984.title: Canadian Caesar Salad
ingredient_list: 2 cloves garlic, coarsely chopped, or more to taste
1/2 teaspoon prepared hot mustard (such as Keen's)
4 dashes hot pepper sauce (such as Tabasco), or to taste
1 head romaine lettuce, torn into bite-size pieces
1/4 cup real bacon bits, or to taste
1 (5 ounce) package croutons, or as needed
4 teaspoons grated Parmesan cheese, or to taste
instruction_list: Place garlic and salt in a wooden salad bowl; mash together with a fork until creamy.
Mash capers into garlic paste.
Mash anchovy paste into garlic mixture until creamy.
Whisk olive oil and black pepper into garlic mixture with a fork until well blended; stir in Worcestershire sauce, vinegar, mustard, and hot pepper sauce.
Whisk egg yolks into mixture; whisk in lemon juice.
Place romaine into the salad bowl and toss with dressing.
Sprinkle salad with bacon bits, croutons, and Parmesan cheese.

270594.title: Karen's Caesar Salad
ingredient_list: 4 anchovy fillets (or to taste...I use a small can, drained)
2 heads romaine lettuce, washed, dried & torn into small pieces
instruction_list: For dressing: Mix the first 10 ingredients together in a blender until well blended.
Set side.
For croutons: Melt 1 stick butter in a nonstick skillet.
After butter is melted, pour in the croutons and saute until the butter is absorbed.
Grate the lb.
of fresh Parmesan cheese on rough (not fine) grate.
DO NOT USE THE STUFF IN THE GREEN CAN!
Must be freshly grated.
Assembly: Place lettuce on four salad plates.
Top each with 1/4 of the croutons and 1/4 of the cheese.
Generously grind fresh black pepper over each salad and top with dressing.

168211.title: Updated Caesar Salad
ingredient_list: 120 each garlic cloves, peeled, thinly sliced
3/4 cup lemons, peels cut off, seeded and diced Safeway 4 ct For $5.00 thru 02/09
instruction_list: Pour milk over garlic; let stand 30 min.
Drain; rinse and pat dry.
Heat soybean oil in medium skillet to 275 degrees F. Add garlic, in small batches; cook until lightly browned, stirring frequently.
Drain on paper towels.
Set aside.
Cut each head of romaine and radicchio lengthwise in half; brush with vegetable oil.
Season with salt and pepper.
Grill just until lightly charred and slightly wilted, turning as needed.
Remove from heat.
Reserve half the romaine for garnish.
Chop the radicchio and remaining romaine coarsely; place in large bowl.
Add dressing, lemon pieces and garlic chips; mix lightly.
For each serving: Place 1/2 head of romaine on one side of serving plate.
Spoon about 2 cups of salad onto other side of plate.
Garnish with 3 slices pancetta, 4 croutons and 1 Tbsp.
of each cheese.

324010.title: Applebee's Oriental Chicken Salad
instruction_list: Preheat oil in deep fryer or deep pan over medium heat.
You want the temperature of the oil to be around 350 degrees.
Blend together all ingredients for dressing in a small bowl with an electric mixer.
Put dressing in refrigerator to chill while you prepare the salad.
In a small, shallow bowl beat egg, add milk, and mix well.
In another bowl, combine flour with corn flake crumbs, salt and pepper.
Cut chicken breast into 4 or 5 long strips.
Dip each strip of chicken first into egg mixture then into the flour mixture, coating each piece completely.
Fry each chicken finger for 5 minutes or until coating has darkened to brown.
Prepare salad by tossing the chopped romaine with the chopped red cabbage, Napa cabbage, and carrots.
Sprinkle sliced green onion on top of the lettuce.
Sprinkle almonds over the salad, then the chow mein noodles.
Cut the chicken into small bite-size chunks.
Place the chicken onto the salad forming a pile in the middle.
Serve with salad dressing on the side.

546410.title: Chicken salad
instruction_list: Mix all ingredients together till well blended

442595.title: California Chicken Salad
ingredient_list: 1/2 cup (125 ml) melted butter, cooled (only real butter)
4 cups (950 ml) shredded cooked chicken breast
instruction_list: Mix together first 6 ingredients, season with salt and pepper, set aside.
Mix chicken, grapes and almonds, set aside.
Place a serving of chicken mixture on bed of lettuce.
Top it with mayonnaise mixture.
Sprinkle with paprika.
Garnish with a few more grapes and almonds.
Serve with hot bread

947887.title: Chicken and Grapefruit Salad
ingredient_list: 4 boneless, skinless chicken breast halves (about 4 ounces each), all visible fat discarded
1/2 cup thinly sliced red onion (about 2 ounces)
instruction_list: In a large nonstick skillet, heat the oil over medium-high heat, swirling to coat the bottom.
Cook the chicken for 3 minutes.
Brush the tops with half the soy sauce.
Turn over.
Cook for 4 minutes, or until the chicken is no longer pink in the center.
Using a clean brush, brush the tops with the remaining soy sauce.
Transfer to a plate and let cool slightly.
Meanwhile, arrange the salad greens on plates.
Top each serving with the grapefruit and onion.
Cut the chicken into thin strips.
Arrange on the salads.
In a small bowl, whisk together the dressing ingredients.
Spoon over the salads.
(Per Serving)
Calories: 221
Total Fat: 3.0g
Saturated: 0.5g
Trans: 0.0g
Polyunsaturated: 1.0g
Monounsaturated: 1.0g
Cholesterol: 66mg
Sodium: 201mg
Carbohydrates: 20g
Fiber: 3g
Sugars: 16g
Protein: 30g
Dietary Exchanges
1 Fruit
1 Vegetable
3 Very Lean Meat

190384.title: Chicken Mandarin Salad Recipe
ingredient_list: 1 c. whipped cream or possibly Cold Whip
instruction_list: Combine chicken, onion and salt.
Chill several hrs.
Add in grapes, celery, macaroni and salad dressing.
Chill till ready to serve.
Then add in oranges, nuts, and mix in whipped cream last.

632993.title: Tropical Chicken Waldorf Salad
ingredient_list: 1 12 lbs boneless skinless chicken breast halves, trimmed of fat or 1 12 lbs store-bought rotisserie-cooked chicken
2 medium granny smith apples or 2 medium fuji apples, cored and chopped
34 cup chopped macadamia nuts, slightly toasted
instruction_list: In large saucepan, place chicken breasts and cover with cold water by 1 inch.
Add onion, celery leaves and Kosher salt.
Bring to boil, reduce heat to low and simmer for 10 minutes, until chicken is no longer pink in the center.
Remove from liquid and set aside; discard liquid.
When cool enough to handle, cut chicken into bite-size pieces.
In large bowl, mix together chicken, celery, apples, scallions, grapes and toasted macadamia nuts.
Use sharp knife to split pineapple into sixths from top to bottom.
Slice core off each pineapple wedge and slice off fruit, leaving tufts of leaves in tact.
Use the extra half of pineapple for garnish.
Cut the remaining fruit into chunks and add to chicken mixture.
Set pineapple wedges on plates.
In small bowl, whisk together mayonnaise, sour cream and lemon juice; blend well.
Add dressing to chicken mixture and toss thoroughly.
Add salt and pepper.
Spoon mixture onto pineapple wedges and serve.

669640.title: Zesty Orange Chicken Pasta Salad
ingredient_list: 1/2 cup canned mandarin oranges (in juice), drained
instruction_list: Cook pasta according to package directions.
Mix MIRACLE WHIP, VERYFINE orange juice, ginger and basil in large bowl.
Add pasta, oranges, chicken and pecans.
Refrigerate several hours or until chilled.
Complement salad with TRISCUIT crackers.
Serve a glass of water with the meal.

498217.title: Shrimp Or Chicken Salad Recipe
ingredient_list: 2 cans shrimp or possibly chicken, cooked & cut up
instruction_list: Mix and put over salad.

272217.title: Roast Chicken & Rice Salad
ingredient_list: 1 cup seedless red grapes, halved Target 1 lb For $2.99 thru 02/06
instruction_list: Mix all ingredients lightly in medium bowl.
Serve immediately or cover and refrigerate until ready to serve.

423522.title: Chicken & Grape Salad
ingredient_list: 4 medium oranges, peel washed and grated
8 oz. , cut into bite sized pieces
2 cups red or green grapes, halved
instruction_list: Mix grated orange peel with dressing in medium bowl.
(Save oranges for dessert.)
Add chicken, grapes, and celery; toss lightly.
Cover.
Refrigerate several hours or overnight.
Toss in lettuce just before serving.
Split evenly among 4 plates and sprinkle with sunflower kernels.
Serve each salad with 2 SNACKWELL'S cookies and 1 orange.
Enjoy an 8 fl oz glass of milk per person.

112232.title: Chicken Waldorf Salad
ingredient_list: 1 medium apple, coarsely chopped Safeway 1 lb For $0.99 thru 02/09
2 SNACKWELL'S Sugar Free Lemon Creme Sandwich Cookies, crumbled
instruction_list: Mix chicken, apple, celery, dressing, walnuts and raisins until well blended; cover.
Refrigerate at least 1 hour.
Enjoy yogurt topped with cookie crumbles for dessert.
Serve salad with a glass of water.

564838.title: Creamy Chicken and Potato Salad
ingredient_list: 600 g potatoes, new and tiny in size, halved
instruction_list: Preheat oven to 220 degrees celcius.
Lightly coat an oven tray with cooking spray.
Place the potatoes in a microwave dish, cover and cook on High for 6 minutes.
Dry potatoes and place on the prepared tray.
Lightly coat with cooking spray and bake for 20 minutes or until golden.
Wrap the bacon in absorbent paper and cook in the microwave on High for 2 minutes.
Chop.
Gently toss the potatoes, bacon, chicken, sour cream, mayonnaise, mustard and chives together.
Serve.

295233.title: Almond-Citrus Pasta Salad with Chicken
ingredient_list: 1 pkg. (6.4 oz.) KRAFT Italian Pasta Salad
2 pkg. (6 oz. each) OSCAR MAYER CARVING BOARD Flame Grilled Chicken Breast Strips
instruction_list: Prepare Pasta Salad as directed on package, reserving Parmesan pouch for later use.
Stir in remaining ingredients.
Sprinkle with Parmesan just before serving.

873144.title: Italian Pasta Salad With Grilled Chicken
ingredient_list: 1 lb boneless skinless chicken breast, grilled and cut into strips
instruction_list: Cook pasta according to package directions, drain and rinse with cold water until completely cooled.
Prepare vegetables according to package directions.
Combine all ingredients except dressing in a large bowl, add dressing and toss well.
Serve chilled, or at room temperature.

590686.title: Chicken Caesar Salad Pizza
ingredient_list: 1 pkg. (6 oz.) OSCAR MAYER CARVING BOARD Flame Grilled Chicken Breast Strips
1/2 cup KRAFT Classic Caesar Dressing, divided
instruction_list: Heat oven to 425 degrees F.
Place pizza crust on baking sheet; top with mozzarella.
Bake 7 to 8 min.
or until cheese is melted.
Meanwhile, toss greens with remaining ingredients.
Top pizza with salad just before serving.

868384.title: Chicken Peanut-Mandarin Salad
ingredient_list: 1/2 cup canned mandarin oranges (in juice), drained
1 Tbsp. chopped PLANTERS Dry Roasted Peanuts Rite Aid Buy 1 Get 1 Free thru 02/06
instruction_list: Place first 6 ingredients in a bowl; mix lightly.
Add dressing; toss to coat.
Serve with WHEAT THINS crackers.
Enjoy an OREO 100 Calorie Pack for dessert.
Serve meal with CRYSTAL LIGHT.

675672.title: Chicken Alfredo Pasta Salad
ingredient_list: 1 (7 3/4 ounce) boxof classic pasta mixed salad greens
1 12 cups deli rotisserie-cooked chicken, skinless and shredded
1 cup grape tomatoes or 1 cup cherry tomatoes, halved
instruction_list: In 3 qrt saucepan, cook pasta as directed on box.
Place the two packets aside for future use.
Drain; rinse with cold water to cool and set aside.
In small bowl mix seasoning from packet with the alfredo sauce.
Place cooked pasta, chicken, tomatoes, cucumber, and basi in large serving bowl.
Add alfredo mixture; toss evenly to coat.
Sprinkle top with topping packet from pasta sald mix and basil sprig if desired.

235955.title: Fruit Chicken Tortellini Salad
instruction_list: Cook tortellini according to pkg.
directions.
Drain and rinse with cold water.
In a large bowl, combine the tortellini, fruit and chicken.
In a small bowl, whisk the syrup and orange juice; pour over salad and toss to coat.
Cover and refrigerate for at least 1 hour.
Sprinkle with cashews just before serving.

161850.title: Quick Chicken Caesar Salad
ingredient_list: 1 bottle (8 oz.) KRAFT Classic Caesar Dressing
instruction_list: Place chicken breast strips on greens.
Top with tomato and croutons.
Toss with dressing and cheese.

565755.title: Chicken and Cilantro Salad
ingredient_list: 2 teaspoons pureed chipotle chiles in adobo (canned in Mexican section)
1 14 lbs boneless chicken breasts, cooked and cooled
instruction_list: Salad Dressing:
Mix all of the above mentioned salad dressing ingredients in a blender adding the canola oil slowly at the very end.
Refrigerate for at least 2 hours to meld the ingredients.
Pour over salad ingredients.

186827.title: Tempura Chicken Salad Recipe
ingredient_list: 2 sm. red potatoes, cooked, liquid removed & thinly sliced
3 c. (2 1/2 ounce.) washed, stemmed & torn spinach
instruction_list: In bowl, whisk egg white, 3/4 c. water, salt and flour.
Whisk till no large lumps remain.
Set aside for batter to rest.
Cut chicken breast into bite size chunks.
If batter is thicker than which of pancakes, add in additional 1/4 c. water.
Dip chicken pcs, one at a time, into batter, allow excess to drip off.
In heavy skillet or possibly pot, heat 1" oil to 375 degrees.
Drop chicken into warm oil.
Don't crowd.
When chicken coating turns golden and chicken pcs float to top of oil, remove with slotted spoon and drain on paper towel lined plate.
Season with additional salt.
In salad bowl, combine potato slices and spinach.
Top with chicken pcs.
Prepare dressing and pour over salad.
Toss gently but well.
Serve immediately.
Serves 2.

177178.title: Pip's Chicken Salad
ingredient_list: 12 cup seedless grapes, cut in half (optional)
instruction_list: Cook the chicken until tender.
Cool and shred.
Add 1 cup of chicken broth to moisten.
Add celery, pecans, pineapple, and relish to shredded chicken.
Then add mayo to taste.
Use your own judgmentthe more mayo you use, the more moist it will be.
You can also add the seedless grapes if you want to.
I like to use fresh croissants to make my sandwiches.

374804.title: Top Notch Chicken Salad
ingredient_list: 1 (15 ounce) can fruit cocktail (one regular sized can)
instruction_list: In large bowl, shred the entire chicken, making sure to get all the good chicken meat off.
Two forks are handy.
Add Miracle Whip, red onion, grapes and fruit cocktail.
Drain fruit cocktail first, leaving only a couple teaspoons juice for sweetness in the salad.
Add celery and season with salt and pepper to taste.
Mix well and enjoy!

263843.title: Copycat Applebee's Low-Fat Blackened Chicken Salad
ingredient_list: 14 cup light mayonnaise (or try sour cream!)
8 cups chopped iceberg lettuce (or blend of mixed lettuces)
12 cup shredded fat free mozzarella cheese
instruction_list: Dressing:.
Combine dressing ingredients in a small bowl.Mix well with spoon, and store in refrigerator until ready to use.
Marinade:.
Combine water, lime juice,soy sauce, and Worcestershire sauce in a medium bowl and stir.
Add chicken breasts to the marinade and cover and keep in refrigerator several hours to overnight.
When chicken is marinated, heat an iron skillet(or frying pan) over medium heat.
Now is the time to fire up the grill.
Combine Cajun spice ingredients in a small bowl.
Sprinkle a teaspoon of the spice over one side of each of the chicken breasts.
Make sure to cover the entire suface.
Melt the butter in the hot pan, then sear the spiced side of the chicken breasts for 2 to 3 minutes.
Put 1 teaspoons of the spice on the chicken breast that is not covered.
Turn the chicken over and sear that side for another 2 to 3 minutes.
The surface of the chicken will be coated with a charred, black layer of flavor.
Finish the chicken off on the grill, grilling for 2 to 3 minutes on each side, or till cooked through.
While chicken is grilling, make the salad.
Split the lettuce into two large bowls.
Toss in the red cabbage and carrots, and beans if using.
Mix the cheeses together and top the salad along with the diced egg white.
Sprinkle each salad with diced tomato.
Slice the chicken breast in 1/2" long slices.
Place the slices on top of the salad and serve with dressing on the side.
Enjoy!
Recipe created by Todd Wilbur www.TopSecretRecipes.com.

702381.title: Incredible Chicken Salad
ingredient_list: 2 cups (475 ml) shredded cooked chicken meat (grilled, roasted, bbq, poached, broiled, etc. - just as long as it's tasty)
1/4 cup (60 ml) minced onion - red or white
1/4 cup (60 ml) chopped pimientos or red bell peppers
instruction_list: Mix everything together and serve in sandwiches or toss some salad greens with a bit of balsmic vinegar and walnut or olive oil and serve chicken salad with greens; drizzle some vinigrette around and garnish with toasted garlic croutons.

684940.title: Grape Chicken Salad
ingredient_list: 1 (10 ounce) canwhite chunky cooked chicken breasts
1 cup mayonnaise (add 1/2 cup for creamier salad)
1 cup red grapes, cut in half
3 -4 celery ribs, washed and finely chopped
instruction_list: Open and drain can of chicken, empty into 2 quart bowl and seperate chunks with a fork.
add grapes, celery, onion, water chestnuts, and sugar.
Next add mayo and dijon mustard and throughly mixed ingredients until evenly coated.
Salt and Pepper to taste.

883413.title: Lime-Ginger Fruited Chicken Salad
instruction_list: Combine salad oil, lime juice and ginger and pour over the chicken in a bowl.
Mix well; cover and chill.
Genltly mix with remaining ingredients and serve on watercress or lettuce leaves.

921258.title: Confetti Chicken Salad
instruction_list: Combine peppers, chicken, corn and green onions in a large bowl.
Combine remaining ingredients, except the salt and pepper.
Pour over chicken mixture and toss.
Season to taste with salt and pepper.

442850.title: India-Inspired Chicken Salad
ingredient_list: 13 cup plain yogurt (a high-quality Greek yogurt is best) or 13 cup mayonnaise
instruction_list: Mix all ingredients together.

593943.title: Tangy Tarragon & Mustard Chicken Salad
ingredient_list: 1 medium zucchini, cut into 1/2 inch cubes
8 leaves butter lettuce or 8 leaves leafy green lettuce
instruction_list: Rub the tarragon onto the chicken breasts and salt and pepper them on both sides.
Cook the breasts by steaming them over medium heat or pan fry them in a little olive oil for about 10-15 minutes or until fully cooked.
Test with instant read thermometer (chicken should be at 165 degrees).
Cool the breasts slightly, then cut into 1 inch pieces.
Combine in a small bowl the mayonnaise, mustard and vinegar to make the dressing.
Combine in a larger bowl the chicken, celery, onions, and zucchini.
Add the dressing to the chicken and mix.
Chill or serve at room temperature on a bed of lettuce.
Arrange carrots around the outside edges of the mound of chicken salad.
Can also serve with crackers or sliced French bread.

502958.title: Haitian Coleslaw
ingredient_list: 2 small serrano chilies, seeded, minced (about 2 1/2 teaspoons)
instruction_list: Whisk mayonnaise, olive oil, lime juice, apple cider vinegar, mustard, chopped dill, sugar, chilies, garlic and celery seeds in medium bowl to blend.
Toss cabbage and carrots in large bowl with enough dressing to coat.
Season to taste with salt and pepper.
(Coleslaw can be prepared ahead.
Let stand at room temperature up to 1 hour or cover and refrigerate up to 4 hours.)
Serve cold or at room temperature.

772764.title: Sesame Coleslaw
ingredient_list: 6 cups very thinly sliced green cabbage (about 1-pound head)
2 cups fresh spinach leaves, trimmed, thinly sliced
instruction_list: Combine cabbage, carrots and sliced spinach in large bowl.
Whisk vinegar, oil, sugar, ginger and soy sauce in medium bowl until sugar dissolves.
Season with salt and pepper.
(Cabbage mixture and dressing can be made 1 day ahead.
Cover separately; chill.)
Toss cabbage mixture with dressing.
Season coleslaw with salt and pepper.
Line platter with additional spinach leaves.
Mound coleslaw on platter.
Sprinkle sesame seeds over and serve.

82091.title: Coleslaw
instruction_list: Combine all but cabbage and carrots.
Pour the dressing over the vegetables and blend well.

325043.title: Grandma's Coleslaw
instruction_list: In a very large bowl put cabbage, green pepper and onion, set aside.
In another bowl mix mayonnaise, sugar, vinegar, salt, dry mustard, and celery seed.
Mix well.
Add to cabbage mixture and stir until all is covered with mayonnaise mixture.
Chill at least 4 hours before serving.

436173.title: The Wedge Sandwich - Turkey, Roast Beef, Coleslaw
ingredient_list: 1 lb thinly sliced deli roasted turkey
1 lb thinly sliced deli roast beef
instruction_list: To assemble, lay half of your bread slices flat on a tray.
Start by spreading 1T of Russian dressing on each slice of bread.
Add Turkey and Roast beef.
(approx 4 slices of each depending on how thinly it was cut.
I like mine super thin).
Spread about 1-2T of coleslaw on top of the meat.
Add another 1T of Russian Dressing.
Top with sliced pickle and the second piece of bread.
My husband hates pickles, so we serve them on the side .

265639.title: Ranch-Style Coleslaw with Bacon
ingredient_list: 1 pkg. (16 oz.) coleslaw blend (cabbage slaw mix)
4 slices cooked OSCAR MAYER Bacon, crumbled Rite Aid 2 For $7.00 thru 02/06
instruction_list: Combine ingredients.

938413.title: Slow-Cooker BBQ Pork Sandwiches with Coleslaw
ingredient_list: 1 boneless pork shoulder (3-1/2 lb./1.6 kg) Safeway Buy 1 Get 3 Free thru 02/09
3/4 cup Bull's-Eye Bold Original Barbecue Sauce, divided
1 pkg. (450 g) coleslaw blend (cabbage slaw mix)
1/2 cup Kraft Oil and Vinegar Dressing
instruction_list: Rub meat with combined seasonings.
Place in slow cooker; top with 1/4 cup barbecue sauce.
Cover with lid.
Cook on LOW 8 to 10 hours (or on HIGH 4 to 5 hours).
Meanwhile, combine coleslaw blend and dressing.
Remove meat from slow cooker; cut off and discard excess fat.
Chop meat into small pieces or shred with fork.
Return to slow cooker with remaining sauce; stir to coat with sauce.
Fill buns with meat mixture and coleslaw just before serving.

508378.title: Apple Coleslaw
ingredient_list: 3/4 cup Miracle Whip Calorie-Wise Spread Family Dollar $3.50 thru 02/07
2 medium apples (preferably 1 red and 1 green), chopped
instruction_list: Mix Miracle Whip and honey in large bowl.
Add remaining ingredients; mix lightly.
Refrigerate 1 hour.

478347.title: Chicken and Coleslaw Wrap
ingredient_list: 5 ounces chicken breasts, roasted and diced
2 flour tortillas, each 8 inches in diameter
instruction_list: In a small bowl, add the chicken, coleslaw, pineapple and dressing.
Stir to mix evenly.
Cover and refrigerate for at least 25 minutes.
To serve:.
Top each tortilla with the chicken mixture.
Fold both sides of each tortilla up over the filling, and then roll to close.
Serve immediately.

551420.title: Creamy Broccoli Coleslaw with Raisins
ingredient_list: 1/3 cup MIRACLE WHIP Dressing Family Dollar $3.50 thru 02/07
instruction_list: Combine ingredients.
Serve immediately.
Or, refrigerate until ready to serve.

261399.title: Croatian Coleslaw
instruction_list: Boil the potatoes until just below done.
If using bacon.
fry the pieces until most of the fat is greasing the pan.
Add the onions and fry til soft.
Flavour the onions and bacon liberally with nutmeg.
Add the potatoes and parsley, stirring well.
Allow to fry for a couple more minutes, before serving.

325232.title: Peanutty Sauerkraut Coleslaw
ingredient_list: 3 cups sauerkraut, drained, rinsed and squeezed dry
instruction_list: Toast the wheat germ in a skillet over medium-high heat, stirring constantly, until browned and fragrant, about 5 minutes.
Pour wheat germ onto a plate, and set aside to cool.
Place yogurt, peanut butter, and sugar into a blender, and blend until smooth.
Toss sauerkraut with peanut dressing; refrigerate for 30 minutes to allow the flavors to blend.
Toss with toasted wheat germ just before serving.

921753.title: Lower Sodium Low Sugar Oriental Coleslaw
ingredient_list: 1 (3 ounce) package ramen noodles (any flavor as you will not be using the seasoning packet)
1 (1/4 ounce) packet Herb-ox very-low-sodium chicken broth (from 1 . 2 oz box)
instruction_list: In a large (gallon sized) Ziploc bag, combine the cole slaw, onions, almonds, nuts and broken up ramen noodles.
Close bag and toss well.
In a covered jar combine the oil, vinegar, sugar and chicken bullion.
Shake to emulsify.
Pour over the cole slaw mix close and toss well.
Let chill at least 2 hours better over night.

298192.title: Pammy's Easy Tas-tee Coleslaw (like Grandma Ida's)
ingredient_list: 1 cup Henri's Tas-tee salad dressing (Bottled dressing isle)
instruction_list: In a large mixing bowl, hand mix (stirring) Miracle Whip and Tas-Tee very well.
Add cole slaw mix and stir very, very well.
Place in covered bowl and refridgerate.
Stir well before serving.

315920.title: Southern Coleslaw
instruction_list: Mix together the 1st 3 ingredients.
Add to slaw mix.
Stir well.
Sprikle top with paprika.
Let chill in fridge for at least 1 hour but best over night.

501597.title: Waldorf Coleslaw
ingredient_list: 2 red apples, quartered and thinly sliced Safeway 1 lb For $0.99 thru 02/09
instruction_list: Toss lettuce, celery, apples and walnuts until combined.
Stir in dressing until salad ingredients are coated.
Chill before serving.

532632.title: Grilled Fish Tacos with Creamy Coleslaw for Two
ingredient_list: 2 Tbsp. lime juice, divided Safeway 3 ct For $1.00 thru 02/09
1/2 lb. tilapia fillets Walmart Supercenter 1 pkg For $10.98 thru 02/14
2 Tbsp. KRAFT Mayo Fat Free Mayonnaise Dressing
1/4 cup KRAFT 2% Milk Shredded Cheddar Cheese
instruction_list: Heat grill to medium heat.
Mix 1 Tbsp.
lime juice, dressing and cumin.
Grill fish 4 min.
on each side or until fish flakes easily with fork, brushing occasionally with dressing mixture.
Meanwhile, grill tortillas 1 min.
or just until warmed, turning after 30 sec.
; wrap in foil or towel to keep warm.
Combine remaining lime juice, mayo and cilantro in medium bowl.
Add coleslaw blend; toss to coat.
Use fork to break fish into bite-size pieces.
Top tortillas with coleslaw, fish and cheese; roll up.

626950.title: Fennel, Blueberry & Poppyseed Coleslaw
ingredient_list: 2 stalks celery, cut into 3-inch matchlike sticks
1/2 cup Kraft Calorie-Wise Creamy Poppyseed Dressing
2 cups fresh blueberries Whole Foods 3 For $10.00 thru 02/09
instruction_list: Cut ends off fennel; discard.
Cut bulb lengthwise in half; remove and discard core.
Cut fennel halves crosswise into thin slices; place in large bowl.
Add celery, onions, parsley and dressing; mix lightly.
Gently stir in blueberries.

587130.title: Oriental Coleslaw
ingredient_list: 2 (3 ounce) bags oriental-flavor instant ramen noodles, broken apart
instruction_list: In small bowl mix the vegetable oil, sugar, white wine vinegar, and the 2 small seasoning packets from the Raman Noodles.
Pour over the cabbage and add sunflower seeds and almonds.
Just before serving add the broken Raman Noodles.

218266.title: The Ultimate Coleslaw
ingredient_list: 1 cup Miracle Whip Original Spread Family Dollar $3.50 thru 02/07
6 cups shredded green and red cabbage
1 medium carrot, shredded Target 2 lb For $3.00 thru 02/06
instruction_list: COMBINE all ingredients.
REFRIGERATE.

155777.title: Mom's Ohio Coleslaw
instruction_list: Mix together cabbage, onion and bell pepper.
Add salt, pepper and sugar.
Mix or squeeze with hand until mixture is moist.
Add vinegar and salad dressing, mixing thoroughly.
Top with paprika garnish and refrigerate for an hour to allow the flavors to meld.

45103.title: The Pantry Coleslaw
instruction_list: Blend dressing ingredients in a blender.
Pour dressing over cabbage in a large bowl, and toss well.

156947.title: Best Coleslaw Recipe
instruction_list: About 1 1/2 hrs before serving or possibly early in the day in a large bowl mix mayonnaise, lowfat milk, cider vinegar, sugar, salt, and pepper.
Add in cabbage (8 c., lightly packed) and carrot.
Toss gently till well coated.
Cover and chill about 1 hour to blend flavors.

646955.title: Classic Coleslaw
ingredient_list: 3 tablespoons lemon juice (I use white vinegar)
instruction_list: Combine first 4 ingredients.
Stir in remaining ingredients.
Cover; chill.

680376.title: Aunt Debs Coleslaw
ingredient_list: 2 whole Granny Smith Apples Peeled, Cored & Diced
1- 1/2 cup Mayonnaise Or The Other Mayonnaise Stuff (Sandwich Spread Works Best)
instruction_list: Mix all the ingredients together.
Chill and allow to stand.
Tips:
Use the pickle juice to your taste.
Try not to use mayo if you can help it.
The sweeter sandwich spread devils alternative is what works best in this recipe.

751769.title: The Best Coleslaw
ingredient_list: 34 cup mayonnaise (I subbed fat free greek yogurt)
2 tablespoons sugar (Next time I will use Truvia)
2 tablespoons white vinegar (I used apple cider vinegar)
instruction_list: Mix all ingredients, pour on coleslaw mix and combine well.
Chill for about an hour and serve.

819952.title: Freezer Coleslaw
instruction_list: In a large bowl combine vegetables with salt, let stand 1 hour.
Place remaining ingredients in a saucepan; bring to a boil and boil one minute, cool.
Drain vegetables and add to vinegar mixture stir gently.
Place into freezer containers and freeze.
When ready to use defrost and serve chilled.

998653.title: James Beard's Horseradish Coleslaw
instruction_list: Shred cabbage, and soak in cold salted water for one hour.
To prepare dressing, combine all remaining ingredients together.
When ready to prepare salad, drain cabbage well and toss with dressing.

1026649.title: Zesty Coleslaw
ingredient_list: 1 pkg. (14 oz.) coleslaw blend (cabbage slaw mix)
instruction_list: Mix mayo and dressing in large bowl until blended.
Add remaining ingredients; mix lightly.
Refrigerate 1 hour.

185897.title: RUDY MIKESKA'S COLESLAW
ingredient_list: 6 heads green cabbage, cleaned, cored and shredded
1 head purple cabbage, cleaned, cored and shredded
3 red or orange bell peppers, cored and finely chopped
2 stalks of celery, tops removed, and chopped finely
3/4 cup red wine vinegar, or to taste
6 tablespoons black pepper, more to taste
8 cups Miracle Whip salad dressing, more to taste
instruction_list: In a very large bowl, combine the shredded green cabbage with the shredded red cabbage, shredded carrots, chopped bell peppers, and celery.
Mix to combine all the vegetables evenly.
Then stir in the sugar, red wine vinegar, black pepper and Miracle Whip.
Taste and adjust seasonings.
Serve thoroughly chilled.

959724.title: Aunt Deloris's Corn Salad
ingredient_list: 2 (15 ounce) cans white shoepeg corn, drained
instruction_list: Mix vegetables together in dish.
Thoroughly mix all dressing ingredients and pour over vegetables.
Toss lightly and chill, preferably overnight.

58071.title: Zucchini, Tomato, and Corn Salad
ingredient_list: 1 cup fresh corn kernels (cut from 2 ears)
8 ounces grape or cherry tomatoes, halved lengthwise (2 cups)
Special equipment: an adjustable-blade slicer with julienne cutter or a julienne peeler
instruction_list: Working with 1 zucchini at a time, cut lengthwise into very thin (julienne) strips with slicer, turning zucchini and avoiding core.
Discard core.
Toss zucchini strips with 1 teaspoon salt and let drain in a colander set over a bowl, covered and chilled, 1 hour.
Gently squeeze handfuls of zucchini to remove excess water and pat dry with paper towels.
Cook corn in a small saucepan of boiling water until tender, about 3 minutes.
Drain, then rinse under cold water and pat dry.
Whisk together lemon juice, sugar, pepper, and remaining 1/4 teaspoon salt in a large bowl, then add oil in a slow stream, whisking.
Add zucchini, corn, tomatoes, and basil and toss well.

562267.title: Marinated Corn Salad
instruction_list: Thaw corn in colander under cool running water 2-3 minutes; drain thoroughly and place in a medium bowl.
Slice green onions thinly; add to corn.
Stir in remaining ingredients; let stand 10 minutes for flavors to blend.
Stir and serve.

219164.title: Confetti Corn Couscous Salad
ingredient_list: 16 ounces quick couscous or 12 ounces israeli couscous
3 lbs frozen corn, thawed and cooked,let cool.
2 (12 ounce) cans black beans, drained and rinsed in cold water
3 small zucchini, halved and thinly sliced- use a mandoline
1 cup kalamata olive, pitted and sliced
instruction_list: if using quick cook couscous, cook 2 boxes according to package directions (boil water, add couscous, remove from heat cover for 5 minutes).
if using israeli couscous, steam or boil for 13 minutes, remove from heat.
if boiling, drain.
in a huge bowl add couscous, corn, and the rest of the salad ingredients.
mix dressing ingredients together, add to salad, toss, cover, and refrigerate 1 hour or more.
serve at room temperature.

868691.title: Corn Salad
ingredient_list: 6 leaves lettuce, preferably red-tipped leaf lettuce
instruction_list: Using a sharp knife, cut the kernels off the cobs.
You should have about 5 cups of kernels.
Heat the oil in a very large (12-inch) saucepan.
Add the kernels to the hot oil and saute them over high heat for 3 to 4 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Pour the corn and sauteing oil into a bowl and add the vinegar, Tabasco sauce, mustard, salt and sugar.
Mix well.
At serving time, put a lettuce leaf on each of six plates.
Spoon corn salad, either lukewarm or at room temperature, into the center of each leaf.
Serve immediately.

288722.title: Fresh Corn Salad
ingredient_list: 2 cups corn kernels, cut from three cobs
14 ounces black beans, cooked, rinsed, drained
instruction_list: Cut the kernels from cobs and put them in a pot of boiling water to cover for one minute.
Drain and run cold water over the kernels.
Set aside to cool.
(Frozen corn also can be used.
Make the vinaigrette by combining red wine vinegar, garlic clove, salt and pepper and whisking in the oil at the end gradually.
Put the beans, tomatoes, onion and cilantro in a bowl and pour half of the dressing over it.
Toss gently.
Add the corn and pour remaining half of dressing over it.
Toss gently.
Salad can be served immediately or chilled.

326512.title: Asparagus And Corn Salad Recipe
ingredient_list: 6 x , (100 g) fresh, (6 to 7) asparagus spears
instruction_list: SLICE tomatoes.
Boil and peel potatoes.
Put asparagus spears in a shallow pan.
Pour boiling water over them.
Add in salt and allow to simmer for 10 min.
Remove and pour ice cool water over them.
Drain.
This will keep asparagus fresh and green.
Set aside.
Arrange the potatoes, corn and asparagus in a salad bowl, keeping tomato slices on outer side.
Pour spinach sauce over the salad.
Refrigerateand serve.
NOTES : (Asparagus, tomatoes and fresh corn seasoned with spinach sauce)

1023682.title: Corn Chip Salad
ingredient_list: 1 head Leafy Lettuce, Romaine Or A Combo
8 whole Hard-boiled Eggs, Shells Removed, Then Sliced
1 pound Bacon, Fried Until Crispy Then Crumbled
instruction_list: Make dressing ahead by whisking all of those ingredients together in a small bowl.
Refrigerate until serving time.
Rip lettuce into bite sized pieces and put it into a large bowl.
Add sliced eggs, crumbled bacon and shredded cheese.
Toss to combine.
Add chips and dressing right before serving.
Enjoy!

183896.title: Potato Salad With Ham and Corn
instruction_list: Cut the potatoes into quarters, and put into a special microwave cooking container or heatproof container and microwave for about 7 minutes.
If using a heatproof container, loosely cover with plastic wrap and cook for a little bit longer.
Cut the ham slices into half and then into 5 mm wide strips.
Rinse the corn and drain.
When the potatoes are tender enough so that a skewer goes through easily, crush with a masher.
Add the soup stock granules.
Add the vinegar and sugar and mix again.
When the potatoes have cooled down a bit, add the mayonnaise and mix, then add the ham and corn and mix some more.
Refrigerate until chilled before serving.
Great in bentos too!

46707.title: Asparagus and Corn Salad
instruction_list: This time I used double-roasted, freshly ground packaged sesame seeds.
Some of the seeds are still intact, so retains texture.
Peel the hard part of the asparagus and cut off a bit of the bottom.
Boil the asparagus and cool in cold water.
Cut it diagonally.
Mix the dressing ingredients together, and add the asparagus and corn.

225255.title: "Dill-icious" Corn & Potato Salad
ingredient_list: 1/2 cup Miracle Whip Calorie-Wise Spread Family Dollar $3.50 thru 02/07
3 ears corn on the cob, cooked, cooled
1-1/2 lb. (675 g) new potatoes, quartered, cooked and cooled
2 cups cut fresh green beans (1 inch lengths), blanched
instruction_list: Mix first 3 ingredients in large bowl.
Cut kernels from corn ears.
Add to Miracle Whip mixture with remaining ingredients; mix lightly.

823765.title: Jelly, Pineapple Corn Salad
ingredient_list: 1 package lemon Jell-O gelatin or 1 package lime Jell-O gelatin
instruction_list: Dissolve jello in 1 cup boiling water, beat in miracle whip.
Let stand in refrigerator.
When partially set stir in 14 ounce, drained pineapple and 12 ounce drained corn.
Place in refrigerator until fully set.

42589.title: Chicken Taco Ranch Salad with Bacon, Avocado and Corn
ingredient_list: 4 slices Peppered Bacon, Cooked Until Crisp Then Chopped
instruction_list: Preheat oven to 375 F. Rub the chicken breasts with the olive oil (I find this helps me use less oil and still get the same results in cooking) and put them into a baking dish.
Sprinkle with taco seasoning and bake at 375 F for 30-35 minutes or until done (cook time may vary based on the thickness of the chicken).
Remove dish from oven and set it on a rack.
Allow chicken to cool for about 10 minutes, and then chop.
Add the chicken, corn and chopped bacon into a bowl and stir together.
In a small bowl toss the avocado and lemon juice together.
Add the chopped avocado and ranch dressing into the bowl with the chicken mixture and stir to combine.
Refrigerate for about 30-60 minutes until cold (longer if possible).
Serve chilled on salad or in a sandwich!

497138.title: Baby Corn Salad
ingredient_list: 14 cup baby corn, cut into bite sized pieces
instruction_list: Combine all the ingredients and toss.
You could substitute a different kind of dressing or a different kind of crackers, according to your preferences.

202758.title: Steak Salad with Corn & Tomatoes
ingredient_list: 1/2 cup KRAFT Lite House Italian Dressing, divided
1 beef flank steak (1/2 lb.) Safeway 1 lb For $5.99 thru 02/09
8 cups loosely packed torn romaine lettuce
3/4 cup KRAFT 2% Milk Shredded Cheddar Cheese
instruction_list: Mix 2 Tbsp.
dressing, lemon juice and 1 Tbsp.
cilantro; pour over steak in shallow dish.
Turn steak to coat both sides.
Refrigerate 30 min.
to marinate, turning steak after 15 min.
Heat grill to medium heat.
Remove steak from marinade; discard marinade.
Grill steak 10 min.
or until medium doneness (160 degrees F), turning after 5 min.
Remove from grill.
Let stand 5 min.
Cut across the grain into thin slices.
Cover platter with lettuce; top with meat, tomatoes, corn, cheese, remaining dressing and cilantro.

527806.title: Corn and Shrimp Salad
ingredient_list: 1 lb shrimp (I use frozen, can get fresh)
instruction_list: Cook, peel and shell shrimp if needed (otherwise defrost shrimp if frozen).
In large bowl mix: mayonnaise, and lemon juice.
Add the corn and shrimp - toss.
Season with pepper.
Divide the lettuce and top with shrimp and corn.
garnish with tomatoes and chives.

54874.title: Sundried Tomato, Corn and Bacon Pasta Salad
ingredient_list: 1 (8 ounce) jar sun-dried tomatoes, Packed In Oil
instruction_list: Place bacon strips on a large skillet, place the skillet on the stovetop, and then turn the heat on medium-high.
Cook the bacon until it starts to crisp up and then flip to cook the other side.
Remove the bacon and place it on a paper towel-lined plate.
Break the bacon into bite-sized pieces once it cools slightly.
When the bacon is about half-cooked, start boiling water in a medium-large pot.
Once the water comes to a boil, add your pasta and cook until it is just al dente (8-10 minutes for dry pasta).
While the bacon cooks and the water boils, cut the corn off the cob and prepare the sun-dried tomato sauce.
Roughly chop the sun-dried tomatoes, then add the tomatoes and the oil from the jar to the bowl of a food processor.
Add the garlic and parmesan cheese and then process the ingredients until the tomatoes are finely chopped.
After the bacon has cooked, add the corn to the bacon grease (you can drain some of the oil) and cook for about 3-4 minutes, just enough to lightly cook the corn.
When the pasta has finished cooking, drain it, then add it to the skillet with the corn.
Add the bacon and the sun-dried tomato sauce and stir well to coat the pasta with sauce.
Finally, add some diced fresh mozzerella and fresh basil.

971076.title: Side Salad with Edamame Beans, Okra and Corn
instruction_list: Combine the ingredients.
Wash the edamame pods and rub with salt.
Cook in the boiled and salted water.
Cool down and remove shells.
Add the bonito flakes into the mixture.
Wash the okra and rub with salt.
Cook in boiled and salted water.
Cut into about 1 cm-lengths.
Slice the myoga ginger thinly and on the diagonal.
Blanch the corn in salted water and drain in a colander.
Mix everything gently and you're done.

490779.title: Fresh Corn Salad
ingredient_list: 12 cup small-diced red onion (1 small red onion)
instruction_list: In a large pot of boiling salted water, cook the corn for 3 minutes until the starchiness is just gone.
Drain and immerse it in ice water to stop the cooking and to set the color.
When the corn is cool, cut the kernels off the cob.
Toss the kernels in a large bowl with the red onions, vinegar, olive oil, salt, and pepper.
Just before serving, toss in the fresh basil.
Taste for seasonings and serve cold or at room temperature.

27509.title: Confetti Corn Salad
ingredient_list: 1 cup chili cheese Fritos corn chips (crushed)
instruction_list: Mix everything but fritos together, top with fritos and chill before serving.

570804.title: Farro and Corn Salad
ingredient_list: 1 1/2 cups fresh corn kernels (from 3 ears corn)
Kosher salt and freshly ground pepper
instruction_list: Cook the farro as the label directs.
Drain and rinse under cold water, then transfer to a large bowl and toss with 2 tablespoons olive oil.
Heat the remaining 1 tablespoon olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
Add the corn and cook, stirring occasionally, until it begins to char, about 2 minutes.
Add the tomatoes and scallions and cook, stirring, until they just begin to wilt, about 2 more minutes.
Add 1/4 teaspoon salt, and pepper to taste.
Stir the corn mixture into the farro.
Add the arugula, lemon zest and lemon juice and toss.
Season with salt and pepper.
Photograph by Kana Okada

578016.title: Confetti Corn Salad (Ina Garten Back to Basics)
ingredient_list: 4 cups corn (Fresh kernels cut from 5 ears yellow or white corn)
2 tablespoons julienned fresh basil (or all 3) or 2 tablespoons minced fresh chives (or all 3) or 2 tablespoons minced fresh parsley leaves (or all 3)
instruction_list: Heat the olive oil over medium heat in a large saute pan.
Add the onion and saute for 5 minutes, until the onion is soft.
Stir in the bell pepper and saute for 2 more minutes.
Add the butter to the pan and allow it to melt.
Over medium heat, add the corn, salt, and pepper and cook, stirring occasionally, for 5 to 7 minutes, until the corn just loses its starchiness.
Season to taste, gently stir in the basil or other green herbs, and serve hot.

156734.title: Corn Salad
instruction_list: mix all ingredients together.
chill for at least 2 hours.

728571.title: Edamame & Corn Salad
ingredient_list: 1/4 cup Kraft Calorie-Wise Zesty Italian Dressing
instruction_list: Combine ingredients.

352826.title: Fresh Basil Corn Salad
ingredient_list: 12 cup fresh basil, chiffonade (chopped into strips)
instruction_list: Fill a large bowl with ice water.
Set aside.
Boil the corn in a large pot of salted water for 3-5 minutes, just until it loses its' starchiness.
Drain corn and prevent further cooking by plunging into the bowl of ice water.
When corn has cooled, cut the kernels off the cob.
Toss the cut corn with the onions, vinegar, olive oil, salt and pepper.
Add the fresh basil just before serving.
Serve cold or at room temperature.

634851.title: The Realtor's Corn Salad
ingredient_list: 1 pint grape tomatoes, cut in half (or 2 medium tomatoes, diced)
instruction_list: Toss all the veggies together.
Combine the dressing ingredients and blend thoroughly.
Pour dressing over veggies, mix to combine and refrigerate overnight.

830919.title: Fiesta Corn Salad
ingredient_list: 2 cans (15 Oz. Can) Sweet Corn, Drained
1 can (15 Oz. Can) Black Beans, Drained
instruction_list: Mix all the ingredients together in a bowl and serve.
Adjust seasoning as necessary.
I cant wait for the summer to make this with roasted corn.
Yum!

805388.title: Corn Salad
ingredient_list: 2 -3 green onions, sliced thin (or other onion)
instruction_list: Cut kernels from ears and scrape ears to get milk as well.
Combine all ingredients.
Chill at least 30 minutes before serving.

236953.title: Warm Corn and Shiitake Frisee Salad
ingredient_list: 4 ears corn, shucked and corn taken off of the cob
2 small heads frisee, picked and washed
Salt and black pepper to taste
instruction_list: In a tall cup (using a hand blender) or blender cup, add mustard, shallots, soy and vinegar.
Blend and drizzle in 1 cup of oil to emulsify.
Season with pepper and a little salt.
Check for seasoning.
Set aside at room temperature.
Using a hot non-stick pan, coat with remaining oil and saute garlic for 2 minutes.
Add shiitakes and cook until soft, about 4 minutes.
Add corn and saute for 3 minutes.
Deglaze with vinaigrette and just heat.
In a large bowl, place frisee and pour hot vinaigrette over.
Mix well and serve immediately.
PLATING Place in a large salad bowl and garnish with fresh cracked black pepper.

566095.title: Classical Corn Salad
ingredient_list: 250 g crabmeat or 250 g crab sticks
instruction_list: Chop boiled eggs and crab meat (crab sticks).
Add corn and salt.
Stir mayonnaise into the salad.
Mix the salad and refrigerate for a while.

716191.title: Greek Salad: Horiatiki Salad
ingredient_list: 1/3 cup Kalamata or other brine-cured black olives, rinsed
1 cup cherry or grape tomatoes, halved
2 teaspoons fresh lemon juice, or to taste
Salt and freshly ground black pepper
instruction_list: In a large bowl, toss together all ingredients except the feta.
Put feta on 4 serving plates and spoon some of the salad over each.
Serve.

651510.title: Good for You Greek Salad
ingredient_list: 6 black Greek olives, pitted and sliced
instruction_list: In shallow salad bowl, or on serving platter, combine tomatoes, cucumber, and onion.
Sprinkle with oil, lemon juice, oregano, and salt and pepper to taste.
Sprinkle feta cheese and olives over salad.
Serve.

801668.title: Greek Salad
ingredient_list: 1 medium red bell pepper, thinly sliced
1 medium green or yellow bell pepper, thinly sliced
1/2 small red onion, halved and very thinly sliced
4 oz. smoked or baked marinated tofu, diced
3 Tbs. vegetable juice, such as V8
1 cup mixed yellow pear and red cherry tomatoes, halved
2 lbs. Yukon Gold or small red potatoes, peeled and cut into large dice
instruction_list: In large saucepan, combine potatoes and lightly salted water to cover.
Bring to a boil and cook until just tender, about 10 minutes.
Drain, rinse under cold running water and drain well.
Set aside.
Meanwhile, bring medium saucepan of water to a boil.
Add green beans and cook until just tender, about 3 minutes.
Drain, rinse under cold running water and drain well.
Set aside.
Make dressing: In glass jar with tight-fitting lid, combine all ingredients with 1 tablespoon water.
Shake to blend.
In large serving dish or on platter, arrange potatoes, green beans, tomatoes, bell peppers, onion, tofu and pepperoncini.
Pour dressing over and serve.

654885.title: Greek Salad
instruction_list: Chop the tomatos into sizable chunks, for eg, cherry toms halved, beef tom sliced etc.
Slice the cucumber and onion.
